description:
LOVE that they have loyalty/rewards card!
Definitely an incentive to make you come back for more.

Im obsessed with their Oreo coffee flavor!

I don't drink coffee but its my favorite ice cream flavor and I love coffee flavored ice cream paired with texture such as crushed espresso beans or something but this paring is a perfect marriage! Or should I say over the moon;)
author: Jasmine-Desiree L.

description:
Came across this cute ice cream shop while walking around in the Marina. 

Saw that they had a variety full of homemade ice cream!  The thing that caught my eye and sold it to me was the cookie cup. Imagine craving a cookie and loving ice cream?! Best of both worlds if you ask me. 

I got the chocolate chip cookie cup with cookies and cream ice cream. The ice cream was super delicious and being able to eat the cookie cup after topped it off. Instead of wasting paper cups, this cookie cup invention is brilliant. Would definitely come back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Got one scoop of raspberry and coffee oreo cookie. Very creamy and had a strong milk taste. Melts quickly!

Raspberry actually tasted like raspberry and not overly sweet. But my favorite was the coffee oreo cookie, a perfect balance between coffee and oreo! The coffee ice cream was on the sweeter side of ones I've had at other places.
author: Joey W.

description: Standard pricey-but-good creamery joint in SF (3/5 on value). Flavors were a 4/5, but knocking it down to 3/5 because their lavender honey was pretty bad. It's my favorite flavor -- I sampled it and it was great. Then about a quarter way through my cup, I had to stop. The lavender flavor started becoming this cloyingly artificial sweetness.
author: Calvin C.

description: I stopped by this ice cream shop after having brunch a few doors down. I've heard about the honey lavender ice cream here so I already knew what I wanted. We got the ice cream in a cookie cup since it looked interesting. Big mistake! I don't recommend the cookie cup as it's not fresh, it's stale, it's hard, etc. The ice cream will also start leaking all over. The honey lavender ice cream on the other hand was interesting and creamy! I would stop by again if I was in the area!
author: Flora L.

description: This has been one of my favorite ice cream spots in SF until this past weekend, hence I'm knocking off a star. Their Nutella banana flavor is phenomenal. My favorite part about this place are the cookie cups!! Usually their still a little warm when you get them, and not too soft or too hard. They're perfect. Except this past weekend, I got my ice cream in a cookie cup and the cookie was so hard :( it made it extremely difficult to eat. Hopefully this one just a one-off because I have consistently loved it in the past!
author: Amanda F.

description:
The roommate and I wanted dessert. Decided to try Over the Moon on Sunday, March 11th. We placed an order through Caviar for delivery at 9:08pm. It arrived at 9:39pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Mint Chip Ice Cream: Mint ice cream with chocolate chips ($3.70), Pint (+$4.75)
*Coffee Caramel Crunch Ice Cream: Coffee, caramel, and chocolate chips ($3.70), Pint (+$4.75), Waffle cone on the side (+$0.55)
*6 Cookies: Chocolate Chip, Cookies and Cream x2, Snickerdoodle x2, Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip ($10.50)

I got the mint chip while the roommate got the coffee caramel. The mint chip was minty and refreshing. I did find the consistency a little too soft though as it wasn't as creamy as I like. A little airier than normal. The roomie's coffee caramel was richer and thicker. Though it had a very milky flavor. I wanted there to be more black coffee flavor. It almost tasted like a coffee with too much cream. We were really looking forward to the cookies. Unfortunately, we never got them. Not sure if it was Over the Moon or Caviar's fault, but it made our dessert less satisfying. And we couldn't get them redelivered as they were closed by the time we figured out how to report it.

Good ice cream, but I really wanted those cookies. For this delivery experience, three stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
My sisters and I wanted dessert after eating lunch at Super Duper Burger, and we came across this ice cream shop. Its a small cute shop with lots of ice cream flavors to choose from. The flavors that we got are Salted Butterscotch, Pistachio, Butter Pecan, and Cookies&Cream. We all went for the classic ice cream cone =) I got the pistachio flavor, really good. I love the quality of their ice cream. It's creamy, has smooth texture and soft consistency.

Will try the cookie cup ice cream when I come
back! =)
author: Nicole D.

description:
Such a cute little shop, how could I NOT give it 5 stars? "And the cow jumped over the moon." Come on!

The gal behind the counter was so sweet and patient given it was a group of 7 of use barging in there. They have unique ice cream flavors that they let you sample without hesitance. I was so full from lunch, but decided to split a cone with my mom. We tried the Lavendar Honey, Funfetti, and Earl Grey. We settled on the Earl Grey scoop, and it was soooo good. Nothing like a scoop of ice cream for dessert!

They have ice cream sandwiches, too, and you can just walk in and grab a pint to go right from their freezer! Oh yeah, there are these little cookie bowls they have, too. Cute! The location is tight, but has some room to sit in the back. If you have a sweet tooth for some ice cream, I'd definitely give this place a try.
author: Crystal A.

description: Walked in to this place not expecting the unbelievable experience we just had. Met Brian the owner that gave us outstanding service and really took his time to show us around and let us sample different ice cream's. Everything is handmade with the owners heart and tastes fantastic. Highly recommend this place. Try the Oreo cookie. Fresh out the oven.
author: S L.

description: Obsessed with their ice cream! The most amazing and you are either a over the moon or smitten person! Highly recommended :)
author: Ellie J.

description: Cookie Monster greeted us at the door on Halloween with THE best chocolate chip cookie I have ever shared with my grandson. All of the vendors on Chestnut at the Halloween parade are wonderful but I have to say the cookie monster was the best ever and I will be back to fill my bags with cookies from this place it was amazing!! And the nicest happiest Cookie Monster was great!!!
author: Mb M.

description:
Sweet treat in the city. This was a little gem of a ice cream shop i stumbled upon while being out in SF this past weekend. They have a great range of flavors, which you can taste test before hand, and the best part is the cookie cups they have. You basically choose your flavor, and can get it in a chocolate chip, snicker-doodle or oreo cup. (*Yes the cookie is hard like everyone complained about, but if it was soft your ice cream would most likely drip or melt through it. Plus it softens up by the time you get to your last bite.) I tried the Oreo Coffee ice cream with the chocolate chip cup, a delicious treat all for $5. Next time you are in the neighborhood give this place a try, the staff is welcoming with a smile, and who can ever complain about good ice cream. 

P.S. - They have a area in the back you can sit and enjoy your treat as well, and take cute pictures for Instagram and your Yelp review :)
author: Vanessa J.

description:
The cookie cup is YUMMMMY! That's what I come here for (and as I always tell people, I don't even have a sweet tooth). I always order a single scoop of the honey lavender in a chocolate chip cookie cup. The honey lavender is sweeter than I prefer my ice cream, but the lavender is potent and floral-y enough to balance out the taste for me. The cookie cup is light and crispy around the edges, and then as you get to the center of the cookie, it's so chewy -- just like frozen cookie dough! It's a revelation. :)
 
Only complaint is the high price for the cookie cups -- it's $6 for a single scoop in a cookie cup. That's just a bit more than I'd like to pay for ice cream. But I guess I'm not surprised considering it's in a bit of an uppity neighborhood. :(
author: Jazzica D.

description: This place was around the corner from a restaurant my husband I had for dinner so we decided to give it a shot. So glad we did! The cookie butter ice cream is fantastic! The cookies (I had peanut butter chocolate chip) were great and the staff was friendly! Great place!
author: Angela P.

description: the ice cream at Over the Moon was extremely soft in not a good way and frosty for the most part. The flavors were interesting but it was almost 5$ for a tiny scoop so i left feeling like i didn't get my money's worth.. the customer service was very nice however and i wish i at least got to try a cookie and if i ever come again, maybe i'll try.
author: Maya S.

description:
Happened to be in the area and the ice cream craving was too real. I had to choose between Smitten and here, and considering the fact that I have had Smitten in the past, of course I had to give this place a try. I can definitely see why people are saying this place is better than Bi-Rite. I tried a couple of flavors and easily knew it was hands down way better. Their service is also pretty awesome. Normally I'm hesitant on trying more than three flavors, but they actually encouraged me to try more to make sure I'm making the absolute right decision since their flavors do rotate a decent amount.

I decided to get a double scoop of earl grey and honey lavender together. It only costed about $5, which is very reasonable for good quality ice cream. My tastebuds exploded. If I didn't live so far, I definitely would've taken home a pint or two. 

Needless to say, I will definitely be back... with a freezer bag and dry ice soon. Need more of them in my life.
author: Sondra T.

description:
Quality of the ice-cream is really good, consistently creamy texture.


---- ICE CREAM ----

Lemon Cookie: 4.5 stars

Amaretto: 4 stars

Honey Lavender: 3.5 stars


---- COOKIES ----

Chocolate Chip Cookie Cup: 4.5 stars
I had mine fresh out of the oven and it was delicious, except that the ice-cream melted and began to drip out of the cup base corners so not as clean as I'd hoped.
author: Letitia L.

description:
I love this little ice cream shop! Staff is super friendly, the store is SO clean, and the prices are super reasonable especially for this area of SF. I have the Funfetti and it was the best (I can a b-day cake ice cream coonosier so believe me when I say this) birthday cake ice cream I have ever had. Really. None of those icey freezer burned chunks. Super smooth and creamy ice cream. Almost the same texture as Nitrogen ice cream. My boyfriend got the Snickerdoodle and it was amazing as well. In my opinion way better than the over-hyped Bi-Rite. 

Plus, where else can you hear country music in an SF establishment? I absolutely loved it. The decor is cute and simple. Will definitely be returning!
author: Brianna R.

description:
Really busy on a Sunday. There was only one worker but he was super nice despite the stressful situation and many door dashers (I assume) coming in and asking for their orders. I felt bad for the guy working!

Anyways, the ice cream was good. I'm surprised the  cookie cup that I got was still warm and not really hard as I'd think it would get after ice creams on it. I got the peanut butter banana and my sister got honey lavender. The smallest size is a very generous scoop so I was full after. The shop is suuper cute and they actually have seating! Will definitely be back
author: Kimberly L.

description: First off... this ice cream is FANTASTICALLY creamy. The shop offers a ton of flavors, but I was heavily influenced by the customer in front of me to choose the honey lavender ice cream. I wasn't disappointed, but really want to come back and have more of those flavors- especially a coffee one that looked especially amazing. If you're planning to walk around be careful.. this ice cream melts kind of quick. Also, grab a napkin.. because you'll feel some of the sticky luscious creamy goodness sticking to your lips after you've devoured your treat!
author: Nadia H.

description: I was excited to see the cookie ice-cream bowels and all the flavors.  We ordered (chocolate chip bowl with vanilla) and upon my first bite, was slightly disappointed.  It was good, but not over-the-top for me.  The service was great and maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but I'm sure I will be back.
author: Christine T.

description:
We usually always come here or smitten after dinner on chestnut street. 

The staff here are friendly and are patient with you trying flavors even when there's a line. And the price is very reasonable! It's also a small narrow shop so don't expect to find seating. 

They have some great flavors including salted butterscotch and mint chocolate chip which I usually go for.

They have cookies, which you can make a cookie ice cream sandwich with, but unfortunately don't have a gluten free cookie option. Also, I've been meaning to try out their shakes since they look so good!
author: Gita r.

description: Omg best ice cream in the marina area.. the oreo swirl is so smooth it just melts in your mouth and the coffee Oreo is the like best of both world.. caffeine and sugar together I love it and the customer service is awesome. They are so nice and welcoming. If you are in the area I would recommend you coming here to try it out
author: Jennifer V.

description: Went to visit the Bay Area and this ice cream spot was recommended and we definitely not let down on the amount of flavors they have! Really cute ice cream shop and they have Cookie cups
author: Belle S.

description:
Yum in my yum! 2 scoops of coffee caramel crunch please!! Delicious!! 

This place has so many delicious favors!  I couldn't decide! The guy at the counter over heard me tell my husband that I hope the coffee caramel crunch is good so he got a baby spoon and let me have a taste! SOLD!!

This place was a perfect way to end an incredible day!
author: Darlene M.

description:
This ice cream place was good. I would recommend getting the drumstick flavor. They have about 15-20 flavors available. I probably wouldn't recommend getting the ice cream sandwich though... the cookies were kind of hard and not that amazing. But ice cream was really good! Definitely come here if you are looking to get ice cream. It costs about $5.

There are a couple tables and chairs in the back if you want to enjoy your treat at the place. Parking is on the street and the place is located across the street from the Apple store and Walgreens. I would recommend this place to other people.
author: Jackie C.

description:
This was an excellent ice cream shop - definitely better than Humphrey Slocombe to me. It still doesn't beat my SF favorite, Garden Creamery in the Mission, but it is definitely an excellent options in the Marina. I'd definitely stop by here anytime for a sweet treat.

Also, the guy behind the counter was super nice to us and incredibly friendly. I forget his name, but he was very patients with me taking all my samples and struggling to pick on a flavor.
author: Jenny D.

description: I've actually never stepped foot into this location, but I constantly get Over the Moon delivered to me via GrubHub. All of their flavors are AMAZING and the texture/softness of the ice cream is unparalleled. Definitely one of my favorite ice cream places in San Francisco.
author: James D.

description: Yummy and delicious... variety of coffee and liquor creams... mmmm... but not as hyped as they make it to be... its upscale baskin robbins ...natural flavors ...very creamy ice cream... i prefer my ice cream hard not soo churney.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Can't get much better than cookies and ice cream. The cookies at this place were incredibly tasty! They were simply and perfect. Lightly crunchy on the edges and gooey in the middle. The ice cream sandwich can't be beat! 

4 stars for cleanliness and no bathroom :(
author: Kaley K.

description: We had a lemon cookie ice cream in a snickerdoodle cookie cup. It was absolutely scrumptious! The ice cream was true to its word -- there were little chunks of lemon cookie inside the ice cream. The cookie cup itself was the most interesting part. The cookie was thick enough so that the ice cream did not melt through the "cup" and then it was really fun that we were able to finish some of the ice cream and then bite off some of the cup. The cookie itself is a little bit thick because it has to hold the ice cream, but it definitely tasted fresh. It may be a bit small for two people, but not necessarily for two people who are trying to "be good and somewhat healthy" while eating ice cream ;) Also, the cashier was very friendly (we went on a Saturday night), and we would be back next time we are in the area.
author: Molly L.

description: Nom nom - I really love this place :). My coworkers and I were having sushi nearby and decided to come here after for some ice cream. I got the caramel cookie dough in a waffle cone - really soft and good. They're also open quite late which is a bonus.
author: Mira B.

description: The ice cream is pretty bland. I tried 4 flavors and they were all meh. The cookies are airy and stale tasting with a weird after taste. Cream Is much better. $5 for the whole thing. I'd recommend going to another spot but it's location and inside seating is quite nice I'll say.
author: Kalani R.

description:
WHOOHOOOOOOO anotha one 

Came here for an Uber Eats order and FELL. IN.  LOVE.
No seriously though this is some epic stuff. If you've ever been to Tara's Organic then you'll know what it kinda compares to. 
Yeah. Epiiiiiiiiiiic.

Both workers were super friendly and patient with my indecisiveness. Explaining everything patiently yet fun is how I would describe them. Went with Andes Mint Chip and a Cookies and Cream cookie! Very easy to eat even WHILE I was driving (no I don't do that all the time). Love my ice cream with a good balance of creamy yet firm. I'd best describe this combo as fresh with a soft, milk chocolate kinda finish.   Perfect  

Would definitely come back after any and all meals in the neighborhood!
author: Daniel O.

description:
Eh. Just a typical ice cream place to me. Maybe I'm not an ice cream connoisseur. :/

The bf and I tried the earl gray flavor, and it tasted exactly like the tea. It was delish! The salted butterscotch was way too sweet. We were hoping the salt would subdue the butterscotch's sweetness, but it didn't...

There were some baked goods too if ice cream isn't your main attraction. Though Over the Moon was small, there were some tables and chairs towards the back. Oh. And we also saw a to-go order take place. Ice cream to-go during the winter?! Okay...
author: Andrea M.

description:
If it was possible I'd give this overall rating 3.5 as opposed to 4.

This ice cream is tasty and mad creamy, which I like, but overly sweet. This place is not just over moon, but over the top. The ice cream becomes inedible after a few bites, at least the flavors I had which were funfetti and salted butterscotch. 

The chocolate chip cup needs work, not good, flavorless, and too tough. I would give the chocolate chip cup 2 stars if I could.

But the girl working at the counter was mad gorgeous.
author: Shruti D.

description: My boyfriend and I tried this place for dessert after dinner. I loved the wide variety of flavors and how helpful the staff are (especially with sampling). The single scoops were generous servings. I got the earl grey, which was delightful and so creamy! The place also has a small seating area in the back if you wanted to sit and enjoy. I'd definitely visit again if I'm in the area!
author: Allison M.

description: After seeing the reviews, we decided to drop in while in the Marina.  The reviews & claims about Over the Moon intrigued me.  Sadly for me, the ice cream didn't live up to the hype or 4+ stars.  I tasted a few flavors & nothing wowed me because most were too sugary.  I ordered 2 flavors in a single & they were so underwhelming that I can barely remember what they were.  1 chocolate somethings and ... ???  My friend got a cookie cup & didn't like it because the cookie was hard & lacked flavor.  Maybe it was an off night but it was a prime weekend night so that doesn't bode well in my book.  There is no way I would select Over the Moon instead of Bi-Rite.
author: Kim S.

description: Great prices. Good sizes. Fast service. And a very cute place to sit down and have some ice cream with friends! I went with my friends and we all loved the location and setting, thanks for being so awesome Over the Moon!
author: Frances D.

description: I found this place while trying out MAC'D up around the corner! Their cookies and ice cream are delicious!! I can't wait to go back! I will def bring some cookies home with next time!! The whiskey Praline ice cream is sooo good!!
author: Tahvooche S.

description:
Finished up a business meeting in the area. Didn't want coffee, didn't want food....
How about Ice Cream Yogurt!
This place was perfect for great tasting ice cream. Great modern interiors with adequate seating. They had yogurt with minimum flavors.
author: Pstephan A.

description: If you are in the Marina and are craving ice cream, I recommend trying this place.   I love how there are so many options!  Although they can get busy, it is worth it.  I did come here before and got the cookie monster which was amazing but this time I opted for an ice cream sandwich ($6). I ended up choosing the oreo swirl and wow it was so creamy!  I also got the cookies n cream and peanut butter chocolate chip cookies for my sandwich.  I loved the peanut butter chocolate chip that was so good! This place will not disappoint.
author: Mikayla M.

description: Over The Moon has amazing ice cream. My favorite flavor so far is Drumstick which just rebranded as Nutty Cone Dip. It has peanuts, chocolate, and waffle come inside. After first trying this place, I've stopped by to get a pint every week. The staff here is very friendly and clearly passionate about their product. They make all the ice cream in the back of the store and that's why it's so fresh and delicious. A must try!
author: Kana B.

description:
Cookies - I absolutely love coming to Over The Moon creamy for their chocolate chip cookies. I've tried Sift, Cream, Baked Bear and a few other shops but NO ONE has CC Cookies as good as OTMC: they're big, full of mini chocolate chips and not too sweet - just perfect. 

Ice cream - it's SO sweet. I just can't. The flavors are creative. The chocolate is weak. 

I love the location and friendliness of the staff. I'll continue to come here for the amazing cookies!
author: Angel R.

description:
I came here since I was eating nearby. I was so excited to see honey lavender, I absolutely love flower flavored ice cream. 

I got two scoops, honey lavender and the whiskey praline. The lavender was delicious ! It is one of the strongest lavender ice cream I ever had. The whiskey was flavorful too. But the lavender ice cream stood out. Great ice cream here!
author: Shirley L.

description:
Yum. We came here after dinner at Isa. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 scoops on a waffle cone to share. We got the Earl Grey and Lemon Cookie flavors. The flavors they offered were really interesting. The Earl Grey was so delicious and tastes floral just like the tea but without the pungency and bitterness. The Lemon Cookie was sweet and satisfying with a hint of lemon. The waffle cone was crisp and light.

The quality of the ice cream is rich and decadent. This is definitely a good place to come for dessert after a meal. I only wish there was more seating!
author: Joan S.

description: Lou'ed this place! I had their whiskey ice cream, it was real yum. Price is also pretty decent. Definitely recommend.
author: Sai J.

description: Popped in here on a whim after lunch and loved the idea of a cookie cup for your ice cream. But we both ended up getting a sugar cone. But the ice cream was good, had wonderful flavor and the service was good and quick.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Cute and affordable ice cream shop in the Marin! Perfect spot to cool down after walking around the neighborhood.

Recommend their coffee oreo cookie and earl grey! It's a bit on the sweet side but what ice cream isn't sweet. 

It's also reasonably-priced - $3.50 for single scope, in a cup or one a cone (no extra charges). Very friendly staff and cute store decors. 

There are seats inside but they are all of the way to the back. I would have liked to be closer to the street where I can people watch and enjoy the sunshine.
author: Wendy F.

description: Genius idea, homemade cookie ice cream bowls.  Had not seen that before and the place gets 5 stars just for them (the ice cream was quite good too)!
author: Brian N.

description:
I really liked the flavors of the ice cream I got, honey lavender (I love lavender flavoured ice cream) and whiskey praline (which tasted a bit like a ferrero rocher) but the ice cream consistency was weird and goopy... like when i pulled the spoon out I could wrap the goop up around the spoon a couple of times... I thought it was fun at first, but it ended up just becoming borderline gross.  I'm not sure what causes this consistency/if all the ice cream is like this but I'm not a fan and would not come back here again...

Not apart of the rating, but the parking here is also ridiculous... we found it quite hard to find a parking spot and also the meters are $6.50/hour.
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Good ice cream flavors (I would say maybe a tad more inventive than your standard flavors, but you won't find anything super crazy here), and I love the cookie cups!
author: Catherine S.

description:
In a city that has some of the best ice cream in the US, you have to bring your game. I tried 4 flavors and they all tasted the same. The ice cream here is very thick and carrageenan laced. The cookies were stale. We threw our whole order in the trash it was so bad.

Life is too short for mediocre ice cream
author: Perry V.

description: Came here around 8pm on a Thursday after dinner for desserts! Parking sucks around here but lots to look at when you do find parking. There was a short line when we arrived and got to try flavors before buying. I wish they had the earl grey when I went, but I really enjoyed the mint cholocate chip and the caramel cookie dough on top of my sugar cone. It is $5 for two scoops and they have a specialty where they have fresh baked cookies as a cup for your ice cream or a cookie ice cream sandwich - I was too full so I didn't get the cookies, but I will return for it one day. Service was friend and quick. They also sell freshly packed pints for you to bring home too. There's also a seating area in the back :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Wow. The best of both worlds! Ice cream in a cookie bowl. Natural ice cream in a bowl of chocolate chip, snickerdoodle, oatmeal raisin, peanut butter chocolate chip or Oreo. A great treat!!
author: Lorin S.

description: Manager treated employee that I know extremely disrespectful. This manager does know what to do and always makes a scene about everything. I witnessed the manager grabbing his female employee, (maybe 16) and show her something or try to prove a point. The ice creams taste worse then Safeway ice cream, all you come here to see is the drama between the manager and employees. Never coming back.
author: Stephen W.

description:
I stopped here with a few friends on Sunday as we were looking for a late night spot to appease our sweet tooth. First of all, I love the RENT connection (Over the Moon monologue). It's a cute little shop with some chairs in the back to sit down and enjoy your treat.

I ordered one scoop of the the honey-Lavender ice-cream which was unique and excellent. (Cost $3.50) My friends each got a small chocolate chip cookie and the Coffee Caramel Crunch (Cost $4.75). I had a bite and I must say it was quite good.

The servers were friendly and helpful. Overall a great spot that is open late :)
author: Janie G.

description: This ice-cream joint definitely gives you a "home-y" type of feeling. The worker was very patient with us and allowed us to sample more than average amount of Ice cream flavors since we were very indecisive. I ordered a single scoop, and she allowed us to do a 'secret-menu' half scoop of two different flavors which was great since we couldn't decide on just one. The ice-cream was thick and creamy and the service was great. The pricing was reasonable for the amount you get. There may not be much exotic flavors but still a great ice-cream creamery! Will be back once I go Over the Moon once more (:
author: Binh P.

description: Cute place with great ice cream - standard and fun flavors. Great little seats in the back for devouring.
author: Tamara d.

description: Such good ice cream! Was so happy I stopped in. The woman who worked there was so nice and friendly and the ice cream was great!
author: Aviva M.

description:
Been here a couple of times. It's largely an ice cream parlour but they also have cookies which I think are actually better than the ice cream. 

Get the chocolate chip cookie and the cookies and cream cookie (ask them to warm them up for you)!

On the ice creams, they do have a good variety of flavours and toppings. They also have ice cream sandwiches and have a bowl made from a cookie.
author: Tanay J.

description:
Small ice cream shop in the middle of a lot of high end shops and people.

Ice cream is good - on the rich side but not as rich as some other ice creams.  Great flavors and they let you taste it too.  I personally like their cookies better than their ice cream, especially if they give you a warm cookie.  A few tables in the back and a few stools in the front, otherwise there's not a lot of space to enjoy your ice cream here.

BUT, I also just discovered there's a Smitten ice cream down the street, and I do like Smitten because of how smooth their ice cream comes out, so next time I might do a comparison!

Super friendly but sometimes it looks like there's no one in the shop.  Just ask for help and someone appears out of nowhere!
author: Traci H.

description: I had the frozen banana and it was the best ice cream I've ever had. It had nuts in it! There were so many great choices, definitely will come back again to try more flavors.
author: Maritza A.

description: My first time at Over the Moon was this past weekend, when I discovered they don't use eggs to make their ice-cream! Big win for me. I ordered the Coffee Oreo flavor and it was delicious. I've definitely become a repeat customer! :)
author: Nidhi M.

description:
I had the Cookie Monster ice cream, and it was average. Note: I'm not a huge ice cream fan to begin with, but the blue ice cream and high reviews intrigued me.

But the cookies are to die for! We sat down outside to finish the ice cream and decided to try a cookie, and O M G. They were still warm and oh-so-soft. This might sound weird, but the cookies were fluffy! The texture was really unique -- the inside was almost bread-y and the outside was nice and crunchy. And did I mention it was still warm??

We tried the snickerdoodle and the cookies and cream cookies. They unfortunately ran out of the Oreo flavored ones ): I really liked the snickernoodles while the bf liked the cookies and cream ones. 

I'd definitely come back for the cookies, and to try one of their ice cream sandwiches!
author: Doris K.

description: Staff was friendly, cookies were tasty, ice cream was bland and didn't have much to it.  We got the cookie monster ice cream and it was just vanilla ice cream died blue with a few cookie pieces here and there and it was super soft so you couldn't eat it like an ice cream sandwich.
author: Geena G.

description: Bad service and attitude. The ice cream is too sweet and the waffle cone I got was soft
author: Yuheng D.

description: This is one of the neighborhood ice cream shops and the quality is really good. I've tried the Cookie Monster and pistachio flavors. Prices are reasonable and service is friendly. Be sure to ask for samples!
author: Brian G.

description: Good stracciatella  ice cream. It's creamy but not too sweet. The cookies are good to. However, the cookies are a little cakey
author: Jade L.

description: Really good ice cream. Tart vanilla frozen yogurt. Great service. Price is a little steep.
author: M M.

description: Yum yum yum! The ice cream is super rich and delicious. Got the cookie sandwich. The cookies taste homemade, and are soft and chewy. The salted caramel ice cream is insanely yummy!! Not a lot of seating inside, but the area is so cute to walk around.
author: Kaylee B.

description: Very cool concept of a cookie cup. This is the main reason why I came to try this place out. I sampled a few flavors, and I was totally into the lemon cookie (I'm a lemon fanatic). I ordered a scoop of the lemon cookie on top of a chocolate chip cookie cup, and the total came out to be $5, which was not too bad of a price, considering it's premium ice cream. The cookie was a bit stale and DEFINITELY not gooey and fresh, so I didn't even bother finishing my cookie. However, I think the ice cream made up for it because it was just so creamy with a refreshing lemon kick. I would come here again, except maybe skip the cookie and just get the ice cream in a cone or something.
author: Sue Y.

description:
For all the flavors we tried before choosing the ONE, I have to say the guys behind the counter were pretty patient. 
There was one flavor called "nutty" (tasted like a drumstick) & that was delicious! Will be back!
author: Tina H.

description:
SWEETNESS OVERLOAD! Cute little ice cream shop with a bar to enjoy your ice cream and view the busy city. Two small scoop of ice cream and two cookies came out a total of $9.-- Expensive in my opinion but it was worth the try. 

Ordered:
Small with cookie.
Cookie Monster w/ a chocolate chip cookie: Their chocolate chip cookie is delicious. It's not your average cookie either. It's very moist and chewy; plus the fact I got my cookie warm was the best thing. I like how the ice cream was very creamy but I over did it with the cookie monster ice cream though. Cookie on cookie was too much for me. Glad I found out about this ice cream shop. 

P.S they offer a cookie bowl!
author: May N.

description: Although they have many flavors to choose from, nothing really stands out. Most of the ice cream colors are white too so it's hard to tell which one will really look flavorful(I personally think colorful things taste better). You also get to try the ice cream before you choose your flavor which is really nice. I tried the honey lavender but the "lavender" scent was way too light where you can't really taste it so I tried the whiskey praline and it tasted better the honey lavender so I stuck with the whiskey praline and coconut. Two scoops are $5 is a good price compared to $4.50 for a single scoops at Bi-Rite. The ice cream is a little too sweet for me but come here to try some extraordinary flavors like whiskey praline and earl grey(*wanted to try this but they didn't have it today)
author: Lisa W.

description:
Amazing! I had small size Chocolate ice cream. It  is  the best  ice cream I have ever had. It reminds me of the days when I was a kid and went to school. There was  the same ice cream in our tuck-shop.
So sweet memories. Thank you. I give five stars
author: William S.

description:
I'm surprise that there was a long line even for night time...i guess it was a nice night. 

Had the honey lavender, one scoop for $3.50. I thought its kinda expensive for a small cup. Not sure its that price since its in the marina district. They didnt charge tax which is a good thing but to me its still pricy for a really small cup.

Anyways, the flavor of this ice cream was good. Had some honey/candy crunch. Had that sweetness and taste of the lavender. 

Now i can finally say i tried this place after passing it so many time
author: Julie N.

description: Definitely rich and creamy. I love ice cream so I was happy to taste the funfetti, caramel cookie dough, and chocolate. Nothing wowed me but it's def ice cream so I'll eat it. Funfetti was pretty and fun looking and kinda tasted like cake. I ate it with the caramel cookie dough and both tasted the same  to me - just really sweet and creamy.  Perhaps the cookies compliment the ice cream better so I should opt for an ice cream sandwich next time.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Not a fan of the raspberry sorbet but the cookies look great.

Raspberry sorbet seemed too sweet and lacked raspberry flavor. Last night I had the best raspberry crepe from Ooh La La on Polk. Maybe Im spoiled now. Cool looking polka dot cup but I think you should try their cookie cone.

Interior white with one bright orange accent wall. Music plays at a comfortable level. Some seating in the far back but outdoor benches or eating to go are also good options.
author: Stefan T.

description:
When we found this spot on Yelp after having lunch in the area I was really excited. I love homemade ice cream places and the flavors sounded so delicious...but turns out something gets lost in translation here from concept to final product.

There was a line out the door when we arrived, which I took as a good sign, so we patiently waited. The place is a really narrow store front which makes it a bit stuffy when you get inside, but nothing worth complaining about because everyone takes their ice cream outside (there is only seating for 2-3 people up in front but no other seating area). 

I sampled the funfetti, caramel coffee crunch, frozen banana, and salted butterscotch. These were all flavors that sounded amazing to me but each one fell flat when I tried them. I felt so bad though, because the man and woman working the counter were so nice, so I ordered the salted butterscotch because it was best out of the ones I tried. I had it served in a cookie cup, which was the only thing I loved, and together they ran me about $5.

I was thinking that maybe the ice cream was just outside my personal taste but the two girlfriends I was with were feeling the exact same way. I don't know...service here is excellent but the ice cream was a total miss. Sorry, Over the Moon!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Two stars for the simple fact the ice cream is good! Unfortunately the manager is in there treating his employees like crap. It's sad to see this in front of customers and not even no what's going on behind closed doors.
author: Amber S.

description:
I only came in for a one scooper ($3.50) after dinner and got the honey lavender flavor.  I got pretty excited when I heard they had cookie bowls but they looked either overcooked or stale, so I just opted for a bowl.  

The honey lavender tasted a little soapy?  Honey lavender is usually a pretty difficult flavor to perfect in my opinion, and I don't think it was really captured in mine.  But my other friends also noted their ice cream was pretty meh and on par with Rite-Aid ice cream.  With so many other ice cream shops in SF, I think I'll probably stick to those.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Cravings for ice cream got to myself and group of friends. A friend wanted to try this place out and insisted we go. Once I saw Earl Grey and Honey Lavender, I was set on what I wanted. I opted for a cookie cup for my scoops.

Overall, I regretted the cookie cup the most because it was hard to eat and not particularly tasty so it really was just a more expensive bowl for me. The ice cream was flavorful, but too buttery? I'm not sure how to describe it, but the texture was overly creamy for me and hard to stomach. Granted, I was extremely full from dinner. 

Overall, I probably wouldn't choose to come back here but I am curious about the actual cookies.
author: Sofia R.

description: Over the Moon is over the top.  Wow, how do you get your ice cream so creamy?  I enjoyed the mint chocolate chip, oatmeal - raisin cookie sandwich.  The people that work here are friendly and this place rocks.   Good ingredients and tasty homemade ice cream and cookies .
author: Justin G.

description: I thought scoops of ice cream served in a chocolate chip cookie bowl was only something I'd ever see on BuzzFeed, but they've got 'em here along with a ton of unique flavors like drumstick (what we got), earl gray, funfetti, pb&j and honey lavender. A pretty good treat except I wish the ice cream was creamier and the cookie bowl was softer.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Yum! Great selection of ice cream flavors, frozen yogurt options, add-ons, and the cookie bowl.
The ice cream is rich and creamy, thicker than most other places. 
I enjoyed the "mix-in" flavors I got: chocolate with peanut butter and vanilla with waffle cone bits, hardening chocolate, and peanuts.
The cookie bowl is one thing I liked but won't get again; it holds together but I like soft cookies and didn't love it. Not unhappy with getting it, but wouldn't get it again.
Overall, am for sure going back for the ice cream!
author: Paul M.

description: Yes good. Icecream is good rhey have in cone or in cookie as sandwich. I think the hype is over. This place was empty. Its in the marina so unless they start selling beer to the marina bros or strained tofu to the marina chicks they are gonna be boarded up. Unless there is a possibility of a marina chick getting laid there they also wont support this establishment so good luck to this little icecream place.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
Can't say no to ice cream on a hot day! We stopped by after the Fleet Week airshows and each got a scoop. They have a wide variety of flavors--some unique, some conventional. 

The place was clean and service was very friendly, happily helping us sample some flavors. I was torn between Honey Lavender and Lemon Sorbet, but decided on the sorbet in a sugar cone. My boyfriend got the Oreo Swirl in a cookie cup (very creative!).

We both loved the ice cream, very creamy and flavorful. The Oreo Swirl and the cookie cup were a little too sweet combined, but overall everything was delicious.
author: Julianne V.

description: Limited ice cream flavor but pretty tasty, the froyogurt is okay, but the fresh baked cookies are a must! Warm and gooey deliciousness. I would definitely come back here just for some fresh baked cookies.
author: Amrita P.

description: Loved this place!  I had a scoop of coffee oreo and stracciatella on a plain cone and it was wonderful.  I will try their cookies next time because they looked delicious.
author: Rachel L.

description: 2 flavors in a small! Score. Nice treat while walking around the shops/bars/restaurants on Chestnut in the Marina. I got earl grey and honey Lavender and both were so good. Love the whole gourmet ice scream scene that has exploded between here, Salt & Straw, Humphreys, Bi-Rite, etc.
author: Anya R.

description: I visiting in March. The cookie was perfectly cooked and although it wasn't warm it was nice crunchy, gooey combination. Great for a warm afternoon stroll through the marina. Friendly staff.
author: Olivia S.

description:
Amazing ice cream and always a great place to top off your meal with this ice cream. I would recommend the Cookies and Cream, honey lavender or lemon sorbet.

Great recipes and def worth trying when you're in the Marina.
author: Kunal T.

description: Best ice cream,  not like ones you buy from a grocery store and so many flavors really had to choose which one to get. Must visit if in that area
author: Lavi C.

description: I am updating my opinion about this location in the Marina. I had initially given them four stars. Now a few years later I am dropping them to a two. I just had ice cream delivered, as we do all the time. Again they've sent the wrong ice cream!!! Ugh! If you are like us and have that favorite one. Then you can understand just how annoyed we are. Especially if you are being bad and splurging.. then you want the extra calories to be worth it. The scoops they sent weren't even close to what we wanted. And was the least sweet choice out of all their choices. We had a sweet tooth! We live locally and have ordered many times from the Marina location.  (Several years) We will never order delivery from here again. Lost a good couple of customers guys! Your employees need to flow down, read the orders and pay attention. Bye, Bye
author: Kirk M.

description:
Definitely worth a try if you're craving a cookie ice cream sandwich.

This place is located on a really hip looking street. At least it is at night! The whole street is full of activity, but family friendly activity. The ice cream shop itself if VERY well lit so it's absolutely perfect for pictures! 

The man who helped us was super nice too. He patiently waited while we were tying to decide. They had a flavor called Straciatella, which I've never heard of. It was good! He let me try it before I got it too, which was nice. 

The cookie itself was pretty warm and perfect amount of softness. 

The only thing is that this place wasn't tooooo memorable for me. It was a great little shop and I enjoyed my ice cream sandwich, but the flavors are kind of generic and I could easily make these cookie sandwiches at home or find a place anywhere I go that would have similar flavors and same concept.

Overall I enjoyed the place and would consider coming again if there wasn't another place I wanted to try.
author: Hana B.

description: Ice cream was amazing! It was a hot day in the city so I decided to get some ice cream on my walk. I got Honey Lavender and Earl Grey. Those two together was divine! It was creamy and tasted very fresh.
author: Anissa K.

description: Went after dinner from Blackwood, the family and I had funfetti in a cookie cup (DELICIOUSNESS), mango on a cone, & caramel cookie dough in chocolate chip cookie cup - about $13. Little pricey but it was delicious and we enjoyed the sweet, delicious ice cream treat!
author: Verenice F.

description: I don't like their cookies. I feel like they are too undercooked in attempt to make them extra soft chewy. I do love their icecream; it is perfectly creamy. They had a berry flavor that was perhaps one of the best flavored icecreams I've ever had. I was sad when I learned it was only seasonal, but the other flavors didn't disappoint.
author: L. W.

description:
Since I'm an ice cream lover, I'm surprised I never heard of this place. I was in the area and paypal was offering a deal for Over the Moon, so I just couldn't resist.

Parking in the marina could be a bit difficult depending on the time of day and what day of the week, but in general, the marina is a pretty busy place. It's all street parking or residential parking. You really have to test your luck and patience here.

They have a great ice cream selection here. I ended up getting the coffee caramel crunch with chocolate chip and snickerdoodle cookies. Their ice cream sandwiches are only $4! Personally, the cookies were way too sweet for me. But they were soft baked cookies which I like. But I LOVED their ice cream. They also had Andes mint ice cream which was chocolate ice cream with bits of andes chocolates. This was also one of my faves, the chocolate was rich and not too sweet, reminded me of a fudgsicle and the subtle hint of mint was delicious. They also have the cookie monster flavor which is blue colored vanilla ice cream with bits of chocolate chip cookies, how adorable! They also have other unique flavors like honey lavender and earl grey.

Service was meh. The girl that helped us was definitely not happy to be working on a Saturday night. I came with the bf after dinner and he ordered himself a bag of cookies. I was ordering separately to use my Paypal offer. After helping him, she went ahead and just stood behind the register on her phone! I felt bad for interrupting her but I asked to try some flavors. After sampling, she asked me if I was going to order something with some attitude in her tone of voice. Of course I was going to order something! Why else would I still be standing there after sampling ice cream flavors?! Afterwards, she went to the back and left the front unattended. Pretty unprofessional if you ask me. A group of people walked in right after she left too and they weren't helped until another work came back out.

The only good thing here was their ice cream. Honestly, a 2 star place, but giving it 3 because of their ice cream.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I picked up a pint of vanilla ice cream from them to give it a taste. More like melted marsh mellow refrozen. Didn't like the taste or consistency. Maybe I'm missing something...but I always judge new ice cream by vanilla because you can't disguise anything with taste. Vanilla is vanilla.
author: norman c.

description:
A small shop located in the heart of the Marina.  Not a lot of seating inside, but there are chairs outside to sit and people watch.  Line was out the door when I came on a Sunday afternoon, but the line moved quickly.  Parking is the worst anywhere you go in the marina, so can't blame them for that.

Prices:
Small (one scoop) - $3.50
Medium (two scoops) - $5
Large (three scoops) - $7 
2 Cookie Ice Cream Sandwich-$5 (Must-try) 

The selection is very different than most ice cream shops.  There are a ton of unique flavors including Drumstick and Cookie Monster.  I tried the HONEY LAVENDER, OATMEAL CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE SANDWHICH ($5), and everything about it was perfect.  The cookie is not your ordinary cookie, but rather thick and freshly baked.  The ice cream was higher quality than normal, and the unique flavors really add to the selection.  The cashier also recommended the COFFEE CARAMEL CRUNCH, so I am definitely trying that the next time I'm here.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
So, I will shamefully admit that this marks the fifth time I had ice cream this week. But man, was it worth it! Move on over CREAM, you've got some sugary competition! Kind of. CREAM, in its various incarnations across the Bay Area, is still far more easily accessible than Over the Moon out in Marina, and sometimes convenience does win out over quality (instant ramen, anyone?).

While my friend ordered their coffee caramel crunch with a chocolate chip cookie on the side, I went with their pistachio and a double fudge on the side (neither of us were willing to do a full ice cream sandwich for our first meal of the day). I was initially a little skeptical about the savory and sweet combination, but it worked out fantastically well: the slightly salty pistachio ice cream offset the super sweet double fudge (and chocolate chip half I snagged from my friend) nicely.

Their ice cream alone can't stand up to the likes of Humphry and Mr & Mrs, but was definitely tastier than that of CREAM. Their cookies, on the other hand, were quite tasty on their own, though a little inconsistent in texture: the chocolate chip was nice and soft, while the double fudge was harder. Whether this was due to higher demand and thus, faster turnover for the former, or just a matter of how the cookies are made, I'm uncertain.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The venue's pretty small, with slightly higher counter seating up front, and a few regular two tops in the back, that are perfectly accessible.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out.
author: Johnny W.

description: The caramel cookie dough had a very smooth texture and good flavor. I ordered it with the cookie cup and unfortunately the cookie was not warmed up nor tasted good. There is also no bathroom provided.
author: May M.

description:
Over the moon, the stars and maybe the universe. I'm glad I made my way to Over the Moon from an overcrowded/overrated ice cream shop. It was de most memorable kilometer of my trip. The two of us walked towards the cashier. I ordered an ice-cream sandwich with one oatmeal chocolate chip cookie and a cookies'n'cream cookie. For ice cream I have chosen chocolate/raspberry. 

Everything was absolutely exquisite. My only suggestion for improvement is adding some sort of ventilation, and a bathroom for customers. 
Hopefully I will make my way back to the Marina soon and have some more Over the Moon.
author: Fernanda S.

description: Seriously the best I've cream ever! I'm from Seattle and we have to stop by Over the Moon every time we visit family in the Marina!
author: Rachel M.

description: So many unique ice cream flavors! We got the espresso Oreo and earl grey in a cookie cup  the cookie cup was surprising quite enjoyable! It was a bit crunchy//chewy in all the right areas. Yummy!!
author: Courtney C.

description: Yummy flavors and cookies! I had the ice cream sandwich with oatmeal raisin cookies and ginger ice cream. It was amazing! My husband had the funfetti ice cream, and approved of it (it really tastes like frosting from childhood birthday cakes)!
author: Catherine J.

description:
Their ice cream isn't too thick but creamy! This is comparison to Bi Rite Ice cream.
But over all I like over the moon ice cream. They have about 16-18 flavors and my favorites are:

* Honey Lavender
* Caramel Cookie Dough
* Crunchy Caramel Coffee

Sorry I'm not a sorbet or fruity type of ice cream person, so I have not yet tried those flavors.

And here are their pricings:
* Small (one scoop) - $3.50
* Medium (two scoops) - $5
* Large (three scoops - $7

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description:
Let me just say..... honey lavendar.... does it get much more incredibly delicious than this? No.

Lots of other delish flavors. Great service. Awesome post date spot!
author: Lisa D.

description:
Great service.

Wonderful flavors that I have loved are salted butterscotch,strawberry and vanilla bean.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Love the COOKIES, but the not-so-much the ice cream. In fact, this joint can quiet possibly be one of the top cookie spots in the city! Yes, I would chose this over Cream any day -- because the cookies are THAT good. Their ice cream is very flavorful but a bit too rich and creamy for my liking -- kinda gave me a stomachache. 

Their homemade cookies though... O MG I would come back solely for the Oatmeal Chocolate Chip cookies -- PERFECT googey center, buttery, and full of cinnamon and chocolate sugar goodness. WOW!!

I got Ice Cream Sandwich ($5): coffee caramel crunch ice cream (sounds amazing already, right?), chocolate chip cookie, and oatmeal chocolate chip cookie. I ate the whole thing deconstructed aka I asked for the cookies "on the side", so that I can enjoy each treat individually. 

They are known for their Coffee Caramel Crunch and Honey Lavender flavor. The homemade cookies were the perfect size and shape, medium with height so you know it's gooey and buttery inside -- so amazing!

The man behind the counter could be a bit sweeter, I mean it is an ice shop after all and people want a happy, joyful overall experience. Nevertheless, his service was speedy and efficient, but I did feel pretty rushed to make my choice and move on. It's a bit stuffy inside too, but they have a great countertop seating at the storefront, so it's perfect for people watching. Overall, cookies are worth it and Da Bomb!  I'm a fan fashizzles :D
author: Ellen W.

description: We stopped in here to grab ice cream quickly (like, really quickly because we were about to get a parking ticket). It was a little pricey, but what isn't pricey in San Fran? I like that they have cookies too so that you could make an ice cream cookie sandwich if you had the time and weren't about to get a parking ticket.
author: Nicole D.

description: I had a fantastic experience at Over the Moon!  They offer several flavors of delicious and creamy ice cream! After selecting a flavor, I topped off my sundae with a warm, fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie. Yum! Fast and friendly service! Two thumbs up!
author: Desiree J.

description:
To rate this place anything less than five stars would just be dishonest. 
Easily the best ice cream shop in SF without a doubt! Taste homemade and they always have fresh cookies hot out the oven.
author: Rachel G.

description:
There's nothing wrong with Over the Moon, but I just didn't feel, um, over the moon?

Although they have a wide selection and some of the flavors are innovative, the ice cream was too creamy (if that's a thing). I also tried the cookies, but they simply tasted like break-and-bake. 

Now, I'm not necessarily saying this is a bad thing, but I don't see the need to try it again.
author: Gabriela K.

description: Slightly over-cooked cookies, surly service, and decent ice cream are the hallmarks of this overrated ice creamery. If you're looking for ice cream this establishment is serviceable, but if you have a discerning pallet, or an acute sense of expected service, you should go elsewhere. Try Cream in the mission for a cookie that is superior in all respects.
author: Casey C.

description: Got the freshly made banana ice cream and can I just say "YUM!" A sweet little sweet shop with out of the ordinary ice cream flavors and freshly baked chocolate chip cookies, what more could you ask for?
author: Jen H.

description: I've never had ice cream this good in my entire life!!!! For the price you get a generous amount, and no matter what you order, the ice cream tastes EXACTLY like that. My cousin got PB&J and it tasted so accurate, and I got honey lavender and coffee and the smell and taste were DIVINE for both of them. It's really rich so don't expect to eat 3 scoops like you probably would at Baskin Robbins or Smitten. But. It. Is. Worth. It. I drive an hour for this place every Sunday lol
author: Nykki S.

description:
I came to Over the Moon on a Friday evening with a buddy.

When I witnessed a large party of preteen girls indulging in Over the Moon's delectables and later leave the premise fashionably in limousine, I knew I would be in for quite a surprise!

I was delighted with a scoop of PB&J and a scoop of Mint Chocolate Chip ice cream.
I enjoyed the ice cream's fresh and milky flavor. The chocolate in my mint ice cream also had a nice softer texture (differing from the usually chunkier chocolates that you get in mint ice cream from a grocery store) which blended well with the mint ice cream.

The service was good and the place was well kept. I don't remember the exact price, but I paid roughly $4 for two scoops.

Addendum:

I found the naming of the store to be quite witty. The name of the store pays homage to the nursery rhyme "The Cow Jumped Over the Moon". Check out the cow and the moon in the store's logo! Over the moon is also an idiom that means very happy/delighted.

I guess you could say my experience was "over the moon" :)
author: Anthony S.

description: All around great ice cream. The shop has a great array of flavors which are all innovative and delicious. Would not recommend the cookie cup. Would highly recommend the funfetti flavor ice cream.
author: Rose J.

description:
i love ice cream especially homemade that has thick creamy consistency which this scream really had but the rest was total failure. Overly sweet, extremely sweet. i couldn't get passed 3rd spoon. I had to throw it away. I have a 3 year old and of course I din't want her to eat her scoop either so was trying to figure out what to tell her so she can willingly give her ice cream to me and give up on eating it which was extremely hard. Kids are unfortunately addicted to sweet.
For reference I had vanilla lavender and coconut and she had peanut butter and jelly flavor.
author: Katie H.

description: Over the Moon is amazing! We stopped by Over the Moon twice while staying at a nearby hotel. The ice cream was so creamy and the flavors were creative. I tried pistachio, whiskey praline, and snickerdoodle. Delicious!
author: Nicole B.

description: Delicious, creamy ice cream! Tried the earl grey, cookies and cream, and caramel flavors. I don't think you can go wrong here regardless of what you order! The ice cream is so rich that even a single scoop is almost too much but that shouldn't deter you from heading over to Over the Moon on a hot day!
author: Sol C.

description: visiting from LA & on our last night we wanted have some ice cream while we enjoyed the beautiful city of SF. Well this this spot is the perfect gem! I had cookies & cream with a chocolate chip cookie & my fiancée had coffee caramel. The chocolate chip cookies are fresh out the oven. it's a perfect combination with the ice cream. And before you pick out the flavor the server is not greedy about letting you try the different flavors.
author: Wendy G.

description: The cookies here are so good! Not too sweet but they're thick and soft and chewy. So dangerously good.
author: Julie T.

description: Great flavors, happy service, great tasting ice cream!  Casual happy place! Good service
author: K T.

description:
Flavor quality very inconsistent and mostly subpar. Most of the flavors I tried tasted like much of anything and were way too soft. I could barely taste any raspberry in the raspberry Oreo and couldn't taste any amaretto in the cheery amaretto. The drumstick tasted like it was made from spoiled milk. Nutella banana and whiskey praline were okay. Caramel cookie dough would have been decent if it were more frozen. 

The girl who helped me was super nice. Otherwise this place is a joke.
author: Jessica P.

description: Incredible ice cream sandwiches, yum yum! Docked a star because it's not personally my favorite type of ice cream - it was a tad on the creamy side. But the cookie was good and the standard ice cream flavors were pretty good too (I erred on the side of caution whenever I see flavors like honey lavender...)
author: Judy S.

description:
So often I see people say they have homemade ice cream. When I came here I actually felt like I was eating homemade ice cream in the best way possible.

Over the Moon lacks pretentiousness, and offers incredibly thoughtful flavors, great quality, and the price is right.

So glad to have found it!
author: David K.

description: The staffer we dealt with was fantastic; very patient in letting us taste several different ice creams before making our selection.  I love that you can custom make cookie ice cream sandwiches.  The ice creams themselves were just OK - I would have preferred the flavors to be bolder (i.e., ginger ice cream doesn't really have much of a ginger flavor (try adding candies ginger nibs), the honey lavender also could use a stronger infusion of both lavender and honey).  I ended up going with the Earl Grey because it was the most flavorful.  Overall, a good stop on your culinary and shopping adventures on Chestnut.
author: Donna G.

description:
Best. Ice. Cream!! Try the Funfetti - it's a birthday party in your mouth. Seriously the most legit take on bday cake/cake batter ice cream out there. My mouth waters just thinking about it...

Other great flavors: Andes mint, coffee, etc. really you can't go wrong.

Nom nom nom. Over the MOOn!
author: Magda M.

description: We just visited Over the Moon again and they have cookie bowls!  How delicious!  I prefer the ratio of ice cream to cookie with the cookie bowl than an ice cream sandwich.  What a fantastic idea!  Our whole family (from 2-60) loves their ice cream and cookies (bowls or sandwiches).  When we finished our ice cream my two year old (almost 3) said "that was yummy ice cream!" We will definitely be back for more next time we are in the city.
author: Jill B.

description: Amazing! Generous scoops, super yummy waffle cones.  Great price for what you get! Loved it!
author: Lori T.

description:
I love the cookies and ice cream here 
What I don't like is the extremely rude, arrogant, smug, entitled, owner or manager (short chubby, big nose male). Almost every time I visit over the moon the manager/owner is being a complete jerk to his employees or deliver couriers. I've seen the staff here change 4 times with in 1 year, no employee seems to last a more than a month or two here every time I come to over the moon it's a new employee with the same mean rude manager/owner breathing down the employees neck micro managing everything the employee does correcting their every mistake not giving them a opportunity to learn. I live in the marina and my kids love the ice cream here however I will not return and I will tell all my friends and neighbors how unprofessional the owner is and how unfairly he treats his employees. I for one do not want to support his behavior or his business and I know my neighbors won't either
author: yoo s.

description: I thought this place was great. The cookie was amazing and the ice cream was good. I would go back
author: Tina L.

description: You can choose 2 different cookies to make the base of the ice cream sandwich! I would stay away from the oreo cookie because it was so hard, but the chocolate chip was amazing! They have a bunch of flavors including green tea and earl grey! You'll definitely find a cookie and ice cream you love! The person making the sandwich is really nice too even though he is the only person working the cashier AND making the sandwiches with a LONG ASS LINE. Props to the hard worker and leave a nice tip! =)
author: Andrew S.

description:
I went there yesterday with my 3 kids and a large group of friends.  Total 4 adults and 8 kids.  I think any treats / desserts shop see a large group like us will be ecstatic to have the business.  Oh....not his place!  
Each of us got a single scoop and some of the kids had toppings with it.  We gladly paid for our ice cream @ $3.50 per scoop and $0.50 per each topping.  Most ice cream shop I've been to in SF will make sure to present a hefty scoop so that their customers can fully enjoy the creation.  The scoop we received was sloppy and slimy.  The toppings were so stingily spread, I can actually count the sprinkles on my daughter's scoop.  I ordered a scoop of the butterscotch, there was no butterscotch flavor at all.  It was all sugar.  It was so sweet, it made me thirsty.  After quarter way through, I couldn't take it anymore.  It was tossed in the garbage.  I don't think I've ever done that with ice cream!
What also made it worst is the service at this place.  The Asian girl at the ice cream bar had a total attitude.  She rolled her eyes when she was taking our order.  The kids in our group were all 6-10 yrs old.  There was no whining or crying on the floor like toddlers do.  We might of been a little loud since we are such a big group in a tight space.  It still does not give her any excuse to have such displeased behavior.  This is not a place any of us will visit again.
author: Patricia T.

description: Oooooh mouth is watering a day later over the caramel cookie dough ice cream and funfetti!! I thought the funfetti was going to be boring - just vanilla but with colorful sprinkles. I was WRONG! It was so good!! I can't explain what the extra flavor was but it wasn't just vanilla with sprinkles - or at least if it was, it didn't taste like it. The guy behind the ice cream was really kind and gave us endless tastes, which my friends and I really appreciated :D
author: Mio W.

description:
This ice cream is OVER THE MOON!
The Carmel chocolate chip cookie dough is the best ice cream I have ever had. Seriously!
The only reason this is not a 5 star rating is because of the atmosphere in the shop. It's just a little too narrow/crowded, and not a place I want to sit and enjoy my ice cream at..
author: Louise S.

description:
Aiiiight.

Found the ice cream to be on the icier side. I tried 3-4 flavors and didn't really like it enough to commit. Bf got mint chocolate chip oreo ice cream sandwich. He said his was good.

Cookies aren't homemade.
author: Shereen A.

description: Pretty good but too rich - fatty mouthfeel and a little too sweet
author: Josie M.

description:
Classic style ice cream with strong flavors.  Competitive pricing and excellent location.

I'd highly recommend the:
-  Oreo Cream
-  Honey Lavender 
-  Snickerdoodle

Protip:  For $4 you can get an ice cream sandwich with your choice of cookie.  The cookies are soft and pliable, not crunchy.  Really glad I opted for this choice.
author: David C.

description:
After eating at Blackwood, we've decided to go next door for some ice cream.

I've only tried the frozen banana and the drumstick ice cream.. I loved both flavors and that's what I got, 1 scoop of each on waffle cone. Just thinking about it makes me miss it as I'm leaving SF. I'll definitely have to return to this place if I'm ever back in this area, it is that good! I really enjoyed the drumstick flavor as it had tiny pieces of sugar cone?  It had chewy texture that I liked and the flavor was perfect! 

My brother and his girlfriend opted for the cookie monster ice cream with cookies (ice cream cookie sandwich), they said the flavor of ice cream was good but the cookie was bit too sweet.

We found a parking structure down the street, it was only 2 min walk. It's also in an area with shops along the street, so you can do some shopping. =)
author: Jasmine V.

description: This place is super yummy! My favorite flavor is the Earl Grey or the Honey Lavender. The only reason it is not five stars is because the tables in the sitting area are sometimes left uncleaned, covered in melting ice cream. Other than that this place rocks!
author: Lizzie S.

description: We stopped by and it wasn't the best ice cream I've had but it wasn't too bad either!  I ordered mine with a cookies and cream cookie and probably could've done without it, didn't have too much flavor.  One of the girls helping us was very nice but the other seemed annoyed that we asked to sample.  Overall not a terrible experience but not sure if I would go back
author: Yarah L.

description: Earl grey ice cream had an interesting savory/sea salt flavor that I couldn't really appreciate. The ice cream texture was also very creamy and quite dense. Different flavors had inconsistent textures. The Nutella Party flavor was much more solid, but the Earl Grey was much softer. There wasn't really any flavor that screamed out to me, although the Honey Lavender was interesting and different.
author: Audrey L.

description: Love, love, LOVE this place!! Where else in SF can you get a made-to-order ice cream sandwich with freshly baked cookies?! And in the posh Marina district, no less. They have quite the cookie selection: chocolate chip, chocolate chip w/ Oatmeal, Orea, cookies & cream, snickerdoodle, peanut butter and oatmeal w/ raisins. They have around 20 ice cream flavors. I tried the earl grey, the lavender honey and the coffee with toffee crunch. The girl that served us was super nice and very sweet, even though we asked to try so many flavors. This place is dangerous to my waistline, but oh so worth it!
author: Alice W.

description: 5 stars for the one on the Embarcadero, zero for this location purely because of the service. Decent ice cream if you get what you ordered, which is never. And don't pay for a topping because it's barely visible.
author: Nancy R.

description: Pretzel, peanut butter, cookie dough ice cream is great! 2-3 minute line max on busy Sunday afternoon. Nothing greater!
author: Erik O.

description: Can't say enough about this ice cream shop. They have some of the creamiest, tastiest gelato I've had since I moved to SF. After I found this place, I went there 2 more times in the same week... That's how good it is. The workers here are also incredibly nice and almost encourage you to try every flavor, which I recommend doing!
author: Jimmy C.

description: Really great ice cream! Came down from SoCal to try it with friends and love their ice cream sandwiches. The ice cream is pretty dense and you can easily share the sandwich with a friend
author: Ray T.

description:
We got a small cup of salted butter scotch ice cream with a chocolate chip cookie on top. 

Heavenly, delicious, ecstasy-inducing

The girl behind the counter was nice and accommodating as we sampled different flavors
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
My S.O. and I really enjoyed this place. Nice selection of traditional and nontraditional ice cream flavors, plus frozen yogurt. 

The girl working was friendly, but did not offer any toppings or samples. She did give us a fresh chocolate chip cookie instead of the ones already out, so that was a plus. I had the mint chocolate chip ice cream and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Solid choice for ice cream and cookies in the Marina.
author: Lyndsey M.

description:
I came here with friends after biking across the Golden Gate as we all wanted to treat ourselves for a good day of biking with some ice cream in the rain. This was my first time trying Over the Moon and I think I would definitely come back again.

Though I was really tempted to get the Oreo cookie sandwich, I ended up just keeping it simple with a scoop of the cookies n cream. I love it when the cookies are soft and chewy and that's exactly how this cookies n cream ice cream was. For $3.50, it might be on the pricier side but I was expecting this so no real complaints. Next time, I think I'll try the Oreo swirl which looked unique!
author: Manosai E.

description:
From the outside its an adorable little ice cream shop. But the inside is as warm and inviting as the people who work there. 

Let's just say that I am an indecisive person. And when it comes to ice cream flavors I'm basically hopeless. But I have to give a serious shout out to the woman who helped me pick my ice cream flavors when I felt like I literally had to try them all. This review is mostly for her because she was just the sweetest thing and she never made me feel like I was being unnecessary. She even went as far to help me with my cookie choice as well after spending like 15 minutes on the ice cream. So yeah she's the real mvp. 

Oh right yeah and their ice cream and cookies are simply amazing too.
author: Megan W.

description:
Ice cream too on the wet side. Ice cream should be hard and creamy, not soupy and creamy. I had the oreo cookie and the flavor was good, it was just more like gelato than anything. Tasted other flavors like funfetti, salted butterscotch and drumstick and they were all soft, so not just a bad batch. 

I also agree with others that prices are a little steep here. $3.50/small scoop but you can easily find other ice cream shops that are better and more worth the money (and line!)
author: Joy A.

description: The ice cream was creamy and thick. It came in delicious crunchy cookies as well! The flavors were delicious and sweet. They have no bathrooms. The shop was clean and fresh! The service was great! I'd come here again any day!
author: Connor B.

description:
Ice cream with the options to put it inside a cookie. The honey lavender is a unique flavor for sure but I'm still a mint chocolate and cookies and cream kind of person.

I can't really compare this with Diddy Reese in Los Angeles so let's just leave it at that.
author: Julia P.

description: Not the best I've had but, pretty good.  I had the honey lavender and that was fantastic.  I sampled the earl grey ice cream and thought that was good.  The caramel coffee crunch was only okay in my opinion.
author: Bellatrix C.

description: I got the Nutella Banana flavor in a cookie cup and it was literally one of the best things that I have ever had. That ice cream was amazing and to top it off it was in a chocolate chip cookie cup which was crispy around the edges and soft in the  middle. It really reminds me of the cookies that I used to bake at home from the grocery store which I might add are pretty awesome. I wish I could've tried their other cookies by it self because they looked so good! Highly recommend this place.
author: Song V.

description: Over the Moon has such a smooth texture to the ice cream. They have a large variety of flavors to choose from and they have cookies! You can make an ice cream sandwich with the cookies, or simply just add one on top of your cone.
author: Jessica S.

description: Tried about 5 flavors and loved them all! Funfetti was surprisingly amazing! I typically like cookies and cream but the Oreo swirl took cookies and cream to another level-wow! And the Cookies and cream cookie was perfection. Favorite ice cream shop in SF so far!
author: Marissa H.

description: Because ice cream really can't get any tastier.. It's creamy, it's fresh, the flavors are unique and tasty. A must eat, must love ice cream
author: Sridevi K.

description: Best ice cream in SF. So creamy and goid. Love all of the flavors. We come and buy 4 pints to go every time.
author: Ari F.

description:
Stumbled upon this place as it was the only ice cream place open at a late hour (10pm) in this area. I sampled the earl grey, honey lavender, and cookie-something-or-other.

I chose the earl grey because it wasn't as sweet as the other two and it REALLY tasted like earl grey tea.

They give you plenty of ice cream in the cups and the price is reasonable. I noticed that they used real earl grey tea leaves in the ice cream as the ice cream was really grainy and infused with tea leaves. 

The place itself is a little unorganized and you don't know where the line starts. Luckily there weren't too many people at this late hour.

Overall I think this is my favorite earl grey ice cream in the area, but I didn't enjoy the other flavors as much. My date didn't like his samples (that I didn't try) enough to order his own scoop.
author: Martina M.

description:
I'm a sucker for ice cream sandwiches, so I was pretty excited to stumble into Over the Moon on a sunny afternoon in the Marina.

I wasn't very hungry, so I asked if I could do a half sandwich (a la CREAM), which they said they couldn't accommodate, so I instead went for one cookie and a scoop of ice cream, which was alright but slightly disappointing because 1) for some reason the staff refused to sandwich the ice cream between the two cookie halves, and 2) my cookie wasn't warm. If you're not hungry, I'd definitely recommend trying to split the sandwich with someone else as the cookie + scoop of ice cream was literally only cents cheaper than what the whole sandwich would have been. To Over the Moon's credit, though, the ice cream was tasty and old-fashioned -- I had the coffee crunch, which went well with the chocolate chip cookie.

I'd come back for regular ice cream if I'm already in the area, but otherwise, the Bay Area has better ice cream and ice cream sandwich options.
author: Kelly R.

description:
My favorite place to buy ice cream!

I love this place for so many reasons: perfect location, friendly staff, clean store. Most importantly, they have an amazing variety of flavors!! My personal favorite is funfetti-- yum! If you can't choose, they let you try a reasonable amount of flavors for free. Definitely would recommend!
author: Barbara P.

description:
Replaced the Yogorino shop (even same Ice Cream freezer) but with much more reasonable prices. They can even make a custom ice cream sandwich for you since they have cookies too!

Check 'em out!
author: Ed L.

description: This is probably one of the best ice cream place I've ever been to. There were a huge variety of flavors, along with little tester spoons to try out as many as you'd like. The flavors were very interesting and rich. The service was great, the woman was very patient with me trying out pretty much every single flavor. She was quite attentive and was quick to get my order. I ordered the "lemon cookie" which I do not regret!
