My friend ordered a shake of "salted butterscotch" which was basically the ice cream melted down into this creamy substance, and it tasted absolutely amazing. I gotta give this to them. Definitely come here if you're looking for diverse and flavorful ice cream, and good service.
author: Josh R.

description: Sure they offer ice cream sandwiches so that's great, but they are very disappointing. The ice cream was melted before it was served. It was textureless and flavorless. How does chocolate not even taste like chocolate? The cookies are not good cookies for their ice cream holding purposes. They were burnt and too hard and thick. The seating area was basically a storage place for all the business's stuff. I.e. old ice cream machines and mops.
author: Erin J.

description: They constantly have the best service and they have some great ice cream flavors. If you're walking down Chestnut and looking for a tasty treat, you should definitely stop by this place. Their cookie monster ice cream has officially become my favorite flavor!
author: Hana K.

description:
Ice Cream was amazing. Loved the drumstick flavor. 

Only problem was the person working there. She was a heavy set woman with red hair. She seemed like she was overwhelmed but because of that she was being extremely rude to the customers. It was my first experience so I didn't know how the things were run there. She was belittling me for not being prepared to answer the ordering questions because she was overwhelmed/stressed

Love the place hate the service.
author: Ernest O.

description:
Make your own ice cream sandwich?? I'm there! Had a great selection of ice cream flavors to choose from. Decided to order a couple ice cream sandwiches to split with friends and was happy with the selection of cookies. Although you'll notice that some cookies are bigger than others so made me feel I should get the biggest cookie to get my money's worth.

Delicious and fun sweet treats :)
author: Kim-Anh P.

description: Their ice cream is amazing, specially the strawberry flavor. So creamy, but yet light, and the perfect flavor! Their other flavors are great too, like mint chocolate chip. I am a regular customer now :)
author: Abhimanyu Y.

description: The guy working here is super friendly. He is the definition of excellent customer service. I tried an ice cream sandwich. It was so rich and decedent!!!
author: Hayden C.

description:
This place is in the heart of the marina. I had my first cookie-ice cream sandwich there
The ice cream was delicious and the cookies super fresh. I will go there again soon!
author: Romain D.

description: Amazing ice cream and cookie. I had the butterscotch and coffee ice cream with a snicker doodle.
author: Jude A.

description: Super friendly staff and lots of options - just didn't find the ice cream all that flavorful. I had the coconut and the mint chip in a cup and it was simply fine.
author: Laurie H.

description:
Ice cream is amazing!! It's so good and fresh! 
The girl who works there Maddie is the sweetest girl ever! I was in there the other day and she was super helpful and lovely!
author: Meagan L.

description: This is my go-to ice cream place whenever I am in the Marina area. The ice cream here is great with a variety of normal & unique flavors from Vanilla Bean and Cookies&Cream to Nutella Banana and Cookie Monster. My favorite here is the Cookie Monster which is blue coloring vanilla and cookies, hence the Cookie Monster from Sesame Street. But the ice cream is rich & so delicious! Definitely recommend this spot when you're in the area
author: Trina N.

description:
Enjoy a rare day in the quaint village of San Francisco in the Marina area I was waiting for a meeting. Seeing the normal Marina "girls" and "guys" that having been roaming around for the years I have been out there but somehow they always remain about 28 as their next step is probably Marin as they get married and have kids and they get recycled for the next crew coming in for the $ and the bleach in their hair.

OK. So now for the ice cream. I am a world expert in coconut ice cream. From my days in the big city known as New York, I would run to HoJos as that was the only coconut option during those days. This place crushes that with the flavor and quality. Truly exceptional across the board and though not the biggest portion or cheapest but all I can say is OMFG this is great stuff. I can't speak to the other flavors but why would I.
author: Rickey B.

description: The idea of this place and its novelty ice cream flavors is ambitious, but poorly executed. The ice cream is way too sweet and concentrated. It's more sugary than rich/creamy. Originally I ordered the second smallest size, but then I noticed the server gave me the smallest size anyway. At first I was annoyed, but upon biting into the ice cream I realized the server was doing me a favor. The ice cream is way too sweet to finish anything other than the smallest size. Nice try, but not for me. After one serving, I feel like I have to have my blood sugar checked for diabetes.
author: Sanaz O.

description: It's a darn good thing that I rarely get to visit The Marina because Over the Moon would be my favorite treat! Their salted butterscotch ice cream is smooth and perfectly balanced between being not too sweet and also slightly salted, this flavor between two of their chocolate chip cookies is the perfect dessert. The cookies are a bit crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside -- yum! I also give 5 stars to the very friendly and super helpful young lady behind the counter who described their various flavors and combinations! I'm sorry I didn't ask her name, she was wonderful!
author: Melanie J.

description: Unbelievably delicious ice cream and soft batch cookies! This review is a few weeks overdue but on the night of mine and my boyfriends anniversary we weren't feeling the dessert list at the restaurant we are at so decided to uber to Over the Moon. The minute we walked up we realized it was 5 minutes after closing and were so sad as we approached the door. The man inside said "come in, I'll take care of you." This literally made my day...yes, I have an ice cream problem! Haha. I'm soooo glad he did this because I had the most delicious honey lavender ice cream and oatmeal raisin cookie to cap off a fantastic night! HUGE thank you to the gentleman who was working on September 4. You're AWESOME! :)
author: Audrey R.

description:
After hanging out in Golden Gate Park and then Chrissy Fields with my husband and our bulldog we were all needing something to grub on. Since we had our fur baby we decided on ice cream.

I quickly goggled ice cream even if I really had a taste for Fentons ice cream. I settled on Over the Moon since they were close and we wanted to be able to share with our furbaby. 

After finding a park - we walked down to the shop and immediately I noticed a small ice shop that had a small town look and feel. The service was good - friendly. I tasted the lavender / honey which was okay and then the vanilla bean which was again okay. I settled on snickerdoodle cookies which are my favorites with vanilla bean ice cream. I then went outside to watch my furbaby and my husband picked his selection. 

We sat in front of the shop and enjoyed the treats we selected. My bulldog loved the vanilla bean but he loves ice cream because he only gets 2 spoons worth as a treat occasionally.

My experience is this a "Cream" like place with a SF vibe to it. While they were inexpensive the portions were definitely very small compared to Cream. Was it very good? I was left with a feeling, " Not terrible and not impressive". The real question is- Will I brave trying to get a parking spot the next time we are out in SF with our bulldog and have a taste for ice cream and the answer is DEFINITELY NO.  

The ice cream was okay, service good, portion size small = I wont be back.
author: Chryl R.

description: Good ice cream at a reasonable price, though I wish the cookies were bigger and crispier. Those who like soft cookies will find them here. There's limited seating inside and outside of the store.
author: Angela C.

description: I got the honey lavender flavor which tastes like a very creamy and mild honey ice cream with bits of dried lavender. It wasn't too sweet for me and it melted really fast on a warm day. Nothing special. I recommend taste testing the different flavors since they offer that.
author: Yuki M.

description: Heaven.  Stopped by for an ice cream sandwich and it may have been the best decision of my life. I'm not kidding. I can't wait to come back in October.
author: David B.

description:
My niece was being sneaky, but she's eleven and adorable and savvy and observant and generally way too perfect for someone who's only been around since 2003.

I was sad that Sweetdish closed, but it's not like I spend much time in the Marina, so maybe it deserved to die?  Sweetdish had ice cream as well.  It was either Mitchell's or Three Twins, but I'll venture to say that Over the Moon's ice cream is better than not-on-San Jose Avenue Mitchell's ice cream.  Because storing and transporting ice cream changes it, somehow.  Or It's-Its.  Whatever.

Good prices, surprisingly.  They're totally wasting all the space they have, but I'm no interior designer, so I don't have any suggestions.

Yelp helped me with this one, so I guess I'm giving credit to my stranger-buddies.  Thanks, stranger-buddies!  They so lovingly replace the doggy water, too.  Who knew?
author: John S.

description:
I'm often on Chestnut  for banking and was so happy to see this adorable new shop. Stopped in and got the very creamy coffee caramel crunch and will be back  to try more. The small was the right portion size to feel like I was getting a treat without guilt. Took home a choc chip cookie for next day- equally as yummy and the right size. 

Noticed a nice spot to sit in the back  as well as by the window, with cool retro photos of people eating ice cream. Very clever design. Apparently they are getting a freezer for ready made ice cream sandwiches etc. May make double parking worthwhile.
author: Joan P.

description: Really amazing ice cream!  Absolutely delicious! I got the cookies and cream ice cream and Cookie Monster with the Oreo chocolate chip cookie and regular chocolate chip cookie! The chocolate chip cookie was literally one of the best chocolate chip cookie I had in my life! Can't wait to come back! :)
author: Ashley D.

description:
2.5 stars

We were in the neighborhood and decided to stop by this place after lunch. We sampled several favors, including our usual favorite honey lavender. However, we were quickly disappointed by these samples to the point we considered not getting anything. Eventually we settled on the Oreo coffee and the Nutella banana. 

The real problem with all the flavors was they were poorly blended together - the honey lavender was overwhelmed by honey with barely a trace of lavender, the Oreo coffee was all Oreo and no coffee, and the Nutella banana tasted strongly of banana with only a weak taste of Nutella bits mixed in. Also, the banana ice cream left an undesirable aftertaste.

The service was friendly but overall we would not come back.
author: Justin T.

description: Not worth the hype and long line. I was able to try as many flavors as I wanted but the ice cream wasn't creamy enough for me. I only ordered because I felt bad I asked for so many samples.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Pretty good! Whiskey praline and cookies and cream cookie were winning combination and service was kind. It's not anything I would go out of my way for and I wouldn't wait in line more than 5 min but the location is great for post-brunch dessert in the area.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Oreo swirl-- my new favorite ice cream flavor! Great service. Awesome flavors.  My daughters tried vanilla & strawberry cones.  Best ice cream so far on our trip!
author: Miss L.

description: Delicious! This is a busy spot, but worth the wait. I got the lavender honey flavor. So good, and it had proved of lavender in it. Yum!
author: Therese M.

description:
Pretty sure that if love was an ice cream flavor, it would be honey lavender.

And if you want to remember your childhood, try their peanut butter & jelly ice cream; it tastes so much like a PB&J sandwich you'll swear you just had lunch while sitting on the grass with your friends.
author: Tori S.

description: I tried the Earl Grey Ice Cream and I really wanted to love it but it was definitely lacking flavor... Very slight hint of earl grey and not enough... The sample spoon of earl grey tasted best sadly and went down hill from there... The guy behind the counter was really friendly and nice though...
author: Anna K.

description: Best Ice Cream Sandwiches in town, hands down. The staff is awesome and friendly which adds to the experience of enjoying the treats.
author: Ryan P.

description: I order from them a lot, usually they are very good. This review is just about my most recent order. Tonight I placed an order, and half of the ice cream wasn't delivered. I called and was informed that I'd get a refund but they were out of my flavor. That's great, but what I wanted was ice cream. Most places would call and give me the option of ordering a different flavor instead of just wordlessly refunding me and leaving me with no ice cream.
author: Michael R.

description: First time at Over the Moon yesterday! Simple menu and very delicious ice cream. I had a scoop of the cookies and cream, so rich and fresh. Will definitely come back for an ice cream cookie sandwich!
author: Allison D.

description:
One of the BEST ICE CREAM I've EVER HAD. 

It's a good balance between ice cream being down-to-earth and innovative/high quality. 

Their cookies aren't necessarily mindblowing, but their ice creams are AMAZING. I can taste the density of quality ingredients so well made together into an ice cream that it's almost chewy! 

I had one scoop of honey lavender and couldn't resist getting another scoop of coconut. OMG. SO good. creative but not crazy! 

Will be back for sure.
author: Jen K.

description: If you haven't tried funfetti you haven't lived. Truly melts in your mouth AND you can buy it by the pint. If I could eat it every night and not get fat I would.
author: Jen B.

description:
Review is only for the honey lavender. 

I tasted it and liked the light taste of honey and hint of lavender. I got a small scoop in a sugar cone and it wasn't until I really started on my ice cream that I realized there were bits of lavender in the ice cream itself. This could be a pro or a con depending on how you feel about little bits of lavender in your ice cream.

I am unfortunately not a fan of the bits of lavender and felt that it was too overwhelming. Maybe that was my mistake but when I tasted the ice cream, I didn't get a chunk with the lavender. I do think that if I had tried it with a piece of lavender I would have went with a different flavor.

Overall, I still enjoyed my ice cream for the most part. The service was nice and the girls that worked tonight were friendly!
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Their ice cream is delicious, and their yogurt is the same as Yogorino, which was there before! :) I loved that yogurt so much, and I'm so glad that they are still serving it in the mean time. The service is friendly, prompt, and efficient, and as an added bonus, it ALWAYS smells like fresh baked cookies in here! 

I would highly recommend trying the coffee toffee crunch, and peanut butter and jelly flavors of ice cream.  Their frozen yogurt is also great if you like tart yogurt.
author: Jennifer Hom C.

description: Cheap tasty desserts. The cookies and cream cookie was  just Ok i would stick with the basic chocolate chip .. but overall can't go wrong with any ice cream and cookie combo
author: Steven S.

description:
Really delicious ice cream sandwiches for only $4! The ice cream is creamy and rich. The cookies are a bit sweet, but they're soft and very good.

Plus, they accept bitcoin :)
author: Phillip K.

description:
After trying Over the Moon twice for its cookie sandwiches a few months ago, I vowed never to return. The cookies were too small, and the sandwich left something to be desired. Every time I saw hordes of people gathered inside, I scoffed at their bad taste in ice cream sandwiches. But maybe all this time, I was the wrong one.. 

After skimming over some more recent reviews, I decided to give them another shot-this time for the ice cream. And WOW, have I been missing out.

We tried three flavors: honey lavender, pb&j, and peanut butter chocolate. All three were extremely rich and creamy. Exactly how I want my ice cream. I must say I'm not a HUGE "normal" ice cream person (I'm no fan of bi rite for example), but this so called "normal" ice cream was amazing. 

I think I just found my new neighborhood dessert spot. And if you, like myself, also gave it a bad rep because of its mediocre ice cream sandwiches a few months ago, give them another try.
author: Rachel L.

description: Great ice cream with a good variety of flavors to choose from. Came here after getting some dinner at pacific catch right around the corner. It is a small place with some seating inside. The service was great, the cashier let me sample a good amount of the ice creams without complaint. I ended up going with the Madagascar vanilla bean, it is phenomenal! Great rich ice cream that was exactly was I was craving flavor wise. My GF got the Cookie Monster which she loved as well, I recommend this spot for desert if you are in the marina!
author: Josue V.

description:
Had an excellent experience at Over the Moon!

Pluses:
- Everything is homemade in the shop, the ice cream AND the cookies
- Variety in cookies and ice cream
- Free samples of ice cream so you can be sure you like what you got (just ask)
- Great customer service, the guy who helped us out was really friendly and patient with us
- They have a non-dairy, non-fat frozen yogurt option
- They have togo options of ice cream and icecream sammies that you can take home to enjoy

Minuses:
- Parking in the Marina is expensive, but you can just skip out on the drive

If we're ever in the Marina, it'll be hard to say no to another snickerdoodle/coffee ice cream sandwich!
author: Grace Y.

description:
While chatting with my wife in this tiny takeout ice cream parlor about what to get, she happened to point out the fresh-made cookies--which my nose had already scouted beforehand--when another customer said, "their cookies are delicious." Followed up by, "the ice cream is great too."

You know a place is good when people are happy to brag about it unsolicited.

Seeing that they had a vanilla bean ice cream, warm chocolate chip cookies, and a custom ice cream sandwich menu item to combine the two sold me. Thankfully, it was served in a wide cup with a spoon, because the ice cream portion was too generous for me to get through it just as a sandwich in my hands.

The cookies were indeed delicious and the ice cream dense and rich. I had no room for this dessert after the lunch I just consumed down the street, but that didn't stop me from devouring my treat. I will be back--after a bit of guilt-induced exercising.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Their chocolate chip cookies for their ice cream sandwiches are AMAZING!!! 
Too bad they don't have more dairy free options
author: Sharon T.

description:
Still decent ice cream. Got screwed by PayPal (again), system down and found out too late to walk out.

Almost had to wash dishes until someone found cash. Damn you pay"pal"!!
author: T J.

description:
Great ice cream, but not a great place to enjoy your ice cream.

Over the Moon truly has ice cream that is out of this world. The cow lept out from Cow Hollow (OMG I just figured out this place's name) and it's leftover milk spewed and became a delicious mix of snickerdoodle and chocolate ice cream that settled in this tiny shop.

The ice cream sandwiches are fully customizable - you choose the cookies and the types of ice cream. Nice! 

My negative remarks have to do with the interior of the place. Unfortunately Over the Moon looks like it was left on the far side of the moon. It's a plainly-decorated, sterile interior like the hallway of an art studio. Cozy but in the wrong way, like when you're trapped under a stranger's armpit on the BART. 

There were only two tables to sit in the back, and one shared bar table facing the street. Quite un-accommodating.

No bathrooms. So I spent the whole time considering whether to pee in my leftover ice cream cup.
author: Jason T.

description:
Prime dip.

Great lunch sandwich: http://www.yelp.com/biz/prime-dip-gourmet-sandwiches-san-francisco-2?hrid=Max4NqOFg_U46_5ar-gOfQ

Great dessert sandwich: Homemade lowfat frozen yogurt paired with a homemade cookies 'n cream cookie. 

Former was sweet with a hint of tartness. Latter was rich and full of flavor. Break apart the latter and dip into the former for something really great.

Staff was friendly, enthusiastic and offered plenty of advice and samples. Really impressed with the variety and how everything is homemade.

This dessert is ready for prime time.
author: Jason B.

description: I had a good experience here. It definitely hit the spot while Sara and I were walking from the palace of the fine arts.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I came here for dessert on a warm evening with friends after having dinner at a nearby restaurant. 

One of the best ice cream places in the neighborhood. Came in and was greeted with a smile. Was offered a sample of each flavor and went for it. Very delicious,  I must say. Ended up getting the minty mint for the night.  Checked in on Yelp and got free toppings. Yes, worth the while! They got tables inside, too, so you can hang out for a bit if you like.

I'm coming for back for more ice cream and cookies.
author: Ellen A.

description: The ice cream is ridiculously creamy. It literally melts in your mouth. Like eating a cloud. I had the lavender honey, and it is delicious. Highly recommend it!!!
author: Josué H.

description:
Stopped by and tried the custom ice cream sandwich. 2 chocolate chip cookies + chocolate peanut butter ice cream = party in my mouth and everyone is invited! 

Insider tip: eat it quick before it makes a mess!!!
author: Travis B.

description: So many unique flavors to choose from! I went with a scoop of the snickerdoodle in  a sugar cube. Generous scoop, fresh, crunchy cone, and the ice cream was so creamy and perfectly balanced with cinnamon. Great shop!
author: V P.

description:
Swore I would take a picture or two for my next review, but I'd already demolished half my ice cream before I remembered...

Anyway, halfway through riding the crimson wave and pathetically squealing "chocolate" from the couch all week, the bf finally acquiesced and found an ice cream shop right around the corner from us (true story). I was OVER THE MOON about his initiative so I, being the sugar mama I am (untrue story), paid $4.75 for both our treats. BALLIN'!

You can get as many samples as you like, so if you wanna annoy the people behind you, try all the flavors like the people in front of us did!

I got one scoop of rocky road and one scoop of coffee caramel crunch on a cake cone and the bf got his usual mint chocolate chip on a waffle cone. SO YUM. Creamy, melt-in-your-mouth delicious, high quality ingredients, kind employees, clean store, bright lighting with seating in the back.

Definitely stop by if you're craving a sweet treat and are in the area!
author: Michele P.

description: The ice cream and the waffle bowl is very good, but I quickly regretted it. Not so much the ice cream, but the bowl. Instant food coma. I only had one scoop of coffee caramel crumble ice cream in a waffle bowl. I walked in very energetic, but after finishing the ice cream and bowl, I was drained of my energy. I would say go for the ice cream, but don't be a glutton and get the bowl too.
author: Stacy C.

description: It is one of those hole in the wall great places to check out. It was my first time going here. I ordered two scoops of ice cream. One was chocolate mint and the other funfetti which were filled into a waffle cone. Very delicious both flavors. And the customer service was good. Only two factors that I did not approve was the very crowded/small seating area. And the limited selection on ice cream. Regardless of limited ice cream selection it was still made up with their other delicious flavors. Overall it checks out pretty ok.
author: Mariela B.

description:
Ohhh hooo yeah.  The only thing I love more than pizza is ice cream.... and this place does ice cream very well.

The Ice cream is great on it's own but you can also get your ice cream sandwich on by adding some cookies.  The wife and I went on date night and I went with the snicker doodle ice cream with the chocolate chip cookies. It almost blew my taste buds right out of my mouth!!!

Brian the owner is also one heck of a guy.
author: Patrick K.

description:
Actually different and *good* ice cream in San Francisco! Personally I've not been wowed by the recent trendy ice cream spots (yes, I know, Bi-Rite is just uh-maiz-ing to you, but I think it's just okay, shoot me now). But between our little group we tried a nice sampling and the consistency and quality of the ice cream was some of the best I've had in the city.

The cookies & cream was outstanding, a flavor everyone tries, but Over the Moon actually crushed it. Thanks!

Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is price, which isn't outrageous, but definitely on the higher end of what ice cream could and should be.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
I'm over the moon! 

Honey lavender, pistachio, lemon sorbet, coffee caramel crunch, and earl grey. 

I'm in love. : )

Creamy, rich, delectable...

Love and ice cream. Eat well. Good life.
author: Christine D.

description: On vacation here in SF from Orange County and randomly yelped this place for dessert after sushi and it's AMAZING!! Ice cream cookie sandwiches with fresh, warm cookies and amazing creamy homemade ice cream! Also, the service is outstanding. The guy working here is the reason I'm writing this review, thanks for the hospitality Sam!!!  :)
author: Bridgette A.

description:
Great combination = earl grey and vanilla.

Cute place with an interesting selection of flavors!
author: Kira G.

description:
Honey lavender was a bit too strong on lavender, wasn't great. Crunchy road was little too sweet. 
It is nice that you can create a custom ice cream sandwich with your choice of ice cream flavor and cookies. But the small
cup only let u get 1 scoop. 
The flavors were not impressive but given the lack of ice cream options in the neighborhood, it is still a popular spot.
author: Nancy Z.

description: Ordered the peanut butter cookie sandwich with the pb&j ice cream. It was good but really  sweet!! Like you needed a cup of water with you after eating that ice cream sandwich. my cookie was not soft or moist and was hard and crunchy. overall I still like cream the best in Berkeley and walnut creek!! Nothing beats their ice cream sammies.
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
Cute name and very neat store. There are a few stools in the front so you can people watch as you are enjoying your frozen dessert. There are a few tables tucked in the back for larger groups. Ready made ice-cream sandwiches and ready packed ice cream is available in the freezers in the front.

We had decided to get 3 scoops and had chose honey lavender, crunchy road and banana. It was all under $5 which isn't bad. You can check-in and score a free topping. Each of the flavors were good, but not amazing. We also tried the oreo cookies which were all right... nothing beats Anthony's Cookies n Cream.

Might return if I am in the area but will not go out of my way.
author: Jay Z.

description: The honey lavender ice cream is absolutely incredible! So rich and flavorful while being the perfect fluffy texture. The mint chip is also great. One of my favorite ice cream spots in the marina.
author: Erica C.

description:
The cookies were perfect, chewy and a little crispy on the edges. 
They Had cute little mini pies. 
We will be back for sure!
author: Tim L.

description:
We happened to walk by and strolled in, because an ice cream sandwich sounded dang good! We tried the following flavors:

Honey lavender - sweet, creamy, and more honey than lavender. Good.
Salted butterscotch - sweet, salty, creamy. Good.
Frozen banana - tasted like they stuck a chocolate-covered frozen banana into an ice cream machine. Quite good!
Coffee toffee crunch - my favorite of the flavors I sampled. Delicious and creamy!

We ended up not getting sandwiches, but I'd definitely come back for the coffee toffee crunch again!
author: Elaine Y.

description: Parking is difficult but the ice cream was good and the price was reasonable! Their cookies are yummy too.
author: Andy K.

description: Now this is the ice-cream that is worth the calories! I absolutely loved the lavender one, and my friend enjoyed their PB&J on the mini-apple pie! Parking is hard to find as always, but there's a Starbucks right next to it, so you can get coffee with your ice-cream :D
author: Anna P.

description:
First-timer and came here with a friend; I found out about this place via a Facebook friend's post.  I sampled their whiskey praline and went for their ice cream sandwiches, using chocolate chip cookie and the whiskey praline ice cream.  Pretty inexpensive for house-made ice cream.  If you didn't want the sandwich, they also have other options like ice cream on cup or waffle cone , and 2 - 3 frozen yogurt options, for those who prefer yogurt.  Great place to chill esp. on a 2nd (in a row) warm San Francisco night.  For those who enjoy simple, more "standard" ice cream flavors with a just a bit of variety, this is your place to be.  

The place itself was comfortable and brightly lit; if you wanted to sit and enjoy your ice cream inside, there are some small tables towards the back of the shop.  OTM is also nicely located 2 store fronts over to restaurant that had a TV outside, for those of us casually enjoying our dessert outside and wanting to catch a sports game.
author: Jessica S.

description: Super tasty ice cream that has a very homemade feel to it. Brian is a chill cat and dishes out the goods quite well. Not sure on the longevity of the store, but I think it is a good place to grab a snack on a chill afternoon or post dinner date stuff. I would come back for sure. Price is right there with any other ice cream place in SF.
author: Ezra B.

description: Great ice cream!!  I tried the peanut butter and it was delicious.  Big servings and good cones too!
author: Caroline C.

description: Couldn't decide so I got one scoop of the ginger and one scoop of the lavender honey in a sugar cone! The lavender honey was my fave, really creamy without being overly rich.
author: Beckie P.

description: The Best ice cream in SF. Rich creamy with interesting flavors. For all the European people, this is the place to go for ice cream when in SF.
author: Vladimir K.

description: Awesome place! Delicious ice cream. Try the double fudge cookie. Or the chocolate chip. Mint chip is my favorite ice cream, but the coffee camel crunch was also really good.
author: Rich P.

description: Grabbed some ice cream here after eating at Dragon Well.  Really tasty flavors.  Got a scoop of the root beer float flavor and it tasted just like it!  Others in our party got cookie monster and really enjoyed that one too.  Would return here.
author: L S.

description: OMG. I love peanut butter and chocolate so I had the peanutbutter with chocolate chunks cookie ice cream sandwich with chocolate peanutbutter ice cream   $5.00. Hubby had snickerdoodles with choc mint ice cream. So for $10 we had a great honemade dessert very nicely done. Wish I took a pucture but it was too good it went fast !
author: Kristin K.

description: I've sampled my fair share of ice cream throughout the years, but the flavors I tried at Over the Moon might be the best I've ever had. Cinnamon smores was amazing- like a churro and a smores cookie combined to make the most heavenly flavor that was both sweet and spicy from the cinnamon. I also had Oreo cookie, not to be confused with cookies n cream, which is ice cream made with the cookie part of the Oreo & swirled with the white creamy oreo frosting. The only thing I dislike about Oreos is the texture of the cookie and this completely solved my problem- plus it gave me a straight shot of the amazing Oreo frosting I love so much. My boyfriend had caramel cookie dough which he claims is his new favorite ice cream flavor. We also got to try one of their freshly baked snickerdoodles, which was perfectly soft on the inside with just a little crisp on the exterior. A perfect accompaniment to any ice cream experience! Don't miss this little place on Chestnut if you're looking for innovative flavors that are old school in creaminess and richness.
author: Stacey O.

description:
Spent the weekend showing family and friends visiting from Romania the City.... This was definitely a stop. Their name says it all, Over the Moon because their desserts are absolutely delicious!!  Love the variety in flavors and presentation ie cookie sandwhich, cups or cones, waffle cones, etc. 
In a quaint neighborhood, can be difficult to find parking at times but so worth it. My fav is the waffle cone with oreo cookie ice cream. 
Enjoy!!!
author: Strovenyia Z.

description: Awesome place. Try half ice cream 1/2 frozen yogurt milk shake. It's the best!
author: Ben S.

description: If you are nearby, you need to go in. You won't regret it. AT all. I sure didn't. Orange chip ice cream. Sweetness in my mouth.
author: Rebekah S.

description: Place is really small.  Across the street from the Ferry Building.  There's not too many flavors here but the ones I got is nice.  Ice cream is not too sweet.
author: Byron L.

description: OMG- this was AMAZING. I loved my ice cream sandwich, I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally got a chance. I got the cookies and cream cookies and the oreo cream ice cream (NOT the cookies and cream ice cream) it was described to me as being similiar to the middle of an oreo and was SOOOO GOOD. The ice cream was super smooth and creamy and the cookies were fresh baked, dense and so yummy. Cannot say enough about this place, a must go for a sweet treat and try this combo if you love Oreo's/ cookies and cream :)
author: Sarah A.

description:
Best ice cream on the block. But they need to update their hours on Yelp, now:

12-10 Sunday to Thursday
12-11 Fridays and Saturdays
author: Wyatt G.

description: I didn't like the ice cream or the cookie, ice cream not creamy and cookie tastes like grease.
author: Debora M.

description: Came here for dessert and ended up getting a ice cream sandwich.  I got the coffee caramel crunch ice cream and oatmeal raisin cookies.  The ice cream was definitely better than the cookies.  The cookies are probably made that morning or the night before, they aren't soft and right out of the oven like I'm used to with CREAM.  Good thing about this place is they give you the ice cream sandwich in a cup that way if it breaks while you're eating it you can still scoop it up with a spoon.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Creamy and yummy enough to compete with the BIG CONES in SF. Only open one week, still getting their rhythm down but the ice cream is perfect . The are friendly and neighborly too. When  the owner discovered that my favorite flavor was chocolate chip he went to the back room and pulled out a special pack of chocolate chip ice cream he was mixing up and asked my opinion. My partner, who has a very critical pallet, loved the ice cream as much as I did.
We are thrilled that Over the Moon has opened in the hood. We will return as the prices are reasonable for an excellent ice cream. Over the Moon gets a well deserved 5 stars from my partner and me.
author: Anna Spathis D.

description: The funfetti is so yummy!!! Great place to grab a cone and walk along chestnut with the family or take over to the park. Recommend it!
author: Z W.

description: I ordered a scoop of lemon sorbet and coffee caramel crunch on a waffle cone (~$4.50). The lemon sorbet was lemony! It tasted like a lemon square in ice cream form. Pretty dynamite -- until a couple more bites in and the sweetness became a tad overwhelming. The coffee caramel crunch was aiiiite. Can't complain. I can't say it's the best ice cream I ever ate... but it's not bad.
author: Annie S.

description: Place is amazing. Walked in randomly and left a huge fan. I had an ice cream sandwich when you can pick two different cookies and have whatever flavor of ice cream that you like.  The staff is super friendly and I would highly recommend this place
author: Jason Y.

description: BEST ICE CREAM EVER!! Ginger ice cream w/ snicker doodle ice cream sandwich was a little piece of heaven. The staff couldn't have been nicer...we tasted a ton of samples. Last night in SF was made memorable by this amazing shop. My family also highly recommends the honey lavender, pb & j, and raspberry ice creams.
author: Melissa K.

description: I was walking by and noticed the old Yogorino shop had been reopened. I went in to see what the new offerings are and was not greeted (sparsely occupied...2 other customers). When I finally got someone's attention to help me it felt as if I had inconvenienced him. I think he might be the manager or owner of the place...news flash you run an ice cream shop perk up a bit. I had to walk out of there, he had so much attitude and was extremely rude. He claimed the froyo recipe is precisely similar to the old Yogorino recipe, but it wasn't as good. The new recipe makes the froyo softer than how Yogorino made it.
author: Kiran J.

description:
It wasnt very good. I had coconut and butterscotch and i had a really hard time finishing it. The coconut one tasted like whipping cream and sugar and it left a really greasy sugary coating in my mouth. The butterscotch tasted like molasses with the same sugary whipping cream after taste. 

This isnt good ice cream no matter how you price it.
author: fernando z.

description: Just had the Oreo mint chocolate chip sandwich.  Awesome - 2 large Oreo cookies and a scoop of homemade mint chocolate chip ice cream.   ...and very reasonable price at 3.75
author: Brandon D.

description: I was just killing time alone the blocks and everyone was out eating ice cream and I started craving. I saw a sign "cookies and ice cream" and decided to try it out because why not? I had this place bookmarked but had no idea until I came inside. It's a pretty small, cute place. Sitting by the window and way in the back. The ice cream flavors didn't  stand out to me much except for the Whiskey Praline. I gave it a try and sure enough, I got it (in a small). And I immediately gobbled that down. Right before dinner. The ice cream is not frozen like most, but on the creamy, soft side. I also got 2 cookies for $2 total! Cookies and cream and Snickerdoodles. The guy gave me the ones straight from the oven instead of the ones in the jar. They were very moist (plus!) and they weren't grainy or flaky or super hard like other cookies. 5$ for everything!! Very cheap, quality taste and texture. Definitely worth it.
author: Yvonne N.

description: The ice cream + cookie deserve 5 stars... really great.  The reason for 1 star, they served them in a styrofoam cup with a plastic spoon.  There are plenty of environmentally friendly options out there for food packaging.  I won't be going back until they make the change to something more responsible.
author: Greg F.

description: Hands down the best honey lavender icecream ever! Better than bi rite any day honey tastes real and non sugary and real bits of lavender. The owner is always making new ice cream flavours and offers us little samples to try and test it. Freshly baked cookies are an added bonus. My comfort treat place in sf.
author: Rujuta G.

description: Tasty coffee crunch ice cream. The honey lavender great too. If I had had enough space to stomach 2 scoops that would have been my second one!
author: Allie Y.

description: Wow, for sure, legit homemade ice cream. You can really taste it in the creaminess. I loved my ice cream, but wish there was a bit more variety of flavors, especially unique, authentic flavors.
author: Meagan T.

description: I absolutely love ice cream and trying new things. When I stumbled upon this place, I became super excited because there was a variety of flavors that were not available anywhere near such as honey lavender, earl grey , green tea, tropical praline and more! I got one scoop of earl Grey and the second scoop of honey lavender. It was okay and I got kind of mad because their scoop sizes are so small! I ordered a Oreo chocolate chip cookie to go along with it and for what I paid, it was not worth it and the cookie did not taste how I expected it to taste. I guess my expectations were too high. I like to go to the liquor store up the street on Fillmore and union where they sell Mitchell's ice cream for really cheap and really huge scoops.
author: Shan M.

description: OMG, the salted butterscotch is absolutely AMAZING!!! Please don't judge me, but I had TWO waffle cones with this smooth, succulently creamy, handmade ice cream! YES!!!
author: M B.

description: I wanted to post a pic of my tasty treat but it was so good I ate it before I had a chance. Whoops. This place is awesome. Warm cookies, great quality ice cream and super friendly staff. They gave me free sprinkles to "brighten my day".
author: Emily K.

description: Small place with some epic ice cream flavors... They had me with their confetti cake flavor.....
author: Max O.

description: I got a cappuccino cookie, chocolate chip cookie, and salted butterscotch. No complaints. It was perfect and worth the $4!
author: Tomas P.

description: This place is gross they do not wash there hands after handling your money. I will never go back.
author: James L.

description: Food coloring, ice cream tastes artificial and way too sweet, country music, and U.S Flag cone wrappers.
author: Kitty F.

description: tasted: nutter butter banana, earl grey & honey lavender. Honey lavender stood out to me so I ordered one scoop in a cup. My daughter got the cookie monster with chocolate chip cookies. Omg..the first 5 bites of the honey lavender was super delicious...but after a while, I got so sick of it! It's really creamy and heavy. I couldn't finish it anymore, kinda ruined my appetite for sweets that whole day!  My daughter's combo was not that great because the cookie monster already has bites of cookies, plus the chocolate chip cookie made it too much cookies!  But the cookie was yummy.  I think I will stick with the frozen yogurts next time.....
author: Alyce l.

description:
Clean, bright, friendly and fun spot!  Even the decor is fun--with a great spinning ice cream display case. The ice cream flavors were innovative, with new twists on old favorites--i.e. Bumpy Road instead of Rocky Road--as well as some great new combinations--my favorite was a Whisky Praline.  A stand out were the cute mini-pies individually wrapped.  The ones I tried were flaky, golden crust with a blueberry/blackberry filling that emphasized the fruit without being overly sweet.  They were great on their own, as well as a complement to the ice cream.  The store will warm up a pie for you to eat there with a scoop of ice cream.  The owner was there, as well as the pie chef, and they were both friendly and happy to be sharing their recipes.

Both the ice cream and the pies emphasize local ingredients and highlight farms and producers from around the Bay Area, so the ingredients are really fresh.

I tried a bunch of ice cream flavors and in the end I bought 3 of the pies and took them home for a dinner party, along with a couple pints of ice cream.  The pies were delicious!  I'll definitely be back!
author: Kate R.

description: Great ice cream and cookies, especially on a hot sunny day walking in the Marina District.
author: Tim T.

description: Awesome ice cream. We are hardly ever down in the Marina but we would come back regularly just for this ice cream. The honey lavender is creamy and I want more just thinking about it. Mmmmm!!
author: Kelin B.

description: Best ice cream in SF. Milkshakes are ridiculous. Cookies too! Do yourself the favor and stop in bc you won't regret it!
author: Justin G.

description: We dropped in the area to get some shoes for running but ended up having ice cream instead. Good quality ice cream, place to sit and eat and friendly staff. They were playing the movie 'Frozen' when I was there so that was fun :)
author: Shruti D.

description: Very creamy ice cream with many different flavors. We ordered the cookie sandwich and the cookies were good as well. But I think I like their ice cream better and would probably just get ice cream next time. We had the pistachio and the drumstick.
author: Uerica W.

description: mmmm, awwww, uhhhhhhh, yaaaaa. Sumptuous flavors, delightful service, mouth-watering ice cream, tingling ambiance, and intense emotions. How did I not find this place sooner?
author: Joe G.

description:
Having read most of the outstanding reviews, I guess I set myself up for more than what should have been expected. 

I ordered an Ice cream cookie sandwich made of snicker doodle cookies and the vanilla bean ice cream. 

1) snicker doodle cookies were so hard and had way too much cinnamon. 
2) The ice cream was ok but the amount of cinnamon in the cookies was pretty much all I could taste.
3) If your going to put my cookie sandwich in a cup at least put a decent amount of ice cream in the sandwich. (Should match the price!) 

I also ordered the whiskey praline and crunchy road both were good. 

Overall, service was good and the ice cream was alright-nothing to rave about.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Best place for ice cream! They have amazing honey lavender ice cream that's to die for!
author: Jigesha D.

description: Their ice cream is simply delicious. I had snicker doodle ice cream and it was amazing. So creamy and smooth but incredibly flavorful at the same time. My boyfriend has the strawberry ice cream and it was incredibly flesh and fruity. The price wasn't too bad and the girl behind the counter was very sweet.
author: Emma W.

description: I'm kind of a purist. Vanilla chocolate strawberry.  When did lavender become more than a bath soap and take on ice cream.  Not my favorite. But none the less their ice cream is very smooth be creamy.  I just urge you to go with your gut. You know what ice cream flavors to order. Don't step out of your comfort zone on this one.
author: Mike D.

description: This is the best ice cream I've ever had. The texture is ridiculously creamy and even when you bring a pint home the texture holds up for a whole week. My favorite by far is the Raspberry ice cream (not to be confused with the Raspberry sorbet). I can also vouch for the Blueberry and Cookies & Cream. The chocolate chip cookies are also to die for - they warm them up for you and they taste like heaven. There's even a little bit of salt on top. I'm obsessed.
author: Amanda B.

description: Try everything twice! This place is the best of both worlds, you not only get original old-fashioned ice cream but also, you guess it, warm, delicious home-made cookies. I've had this place so many times it's become my go-to ice cream shop. Not to mention the service is so great, everyone is always super nice. This shop reminds me of the Mid-West, not sure why.
author: Cindy G.

description: I don't usually write yelp reviews, but I was very disappointed especially after reading such favorable reviews of this place that I decided to share my experience. My friends and I stumbled onto this place after dinner and went inside. It was busy and the server looked a bit overwhelmed. After 10 or so minutes, I finally got my ice cream. I chose Snickerdoodle and Pumpkin Spice Latte. I should note that the flavors were good (although a little sweet when compared to other places). The texture, however, was unappealing to say the least. When I began to eat it, the ice cream stuck to my spoon and fell back into the cup- it had a texture similar to glue or melted cheese that was both stringy and thick like caramel. This ruined any potential that the flavor had. I couldn't stomach more than two spoonfuls before throwing it away. I would likely not come back and waste another $5. I recommend Bi-Rite on Divisadero or Smitten in Hayes Valley for your next ice cream fix- the two are consistently excellent.
author: Dominic L.

description: Spontaneous decision to come in and I'm glad we came in.  Quick line.  The girl working was really nice and guided us on what to get, since we've never been there before.  Got the ice cream sandwich with fresh warm cookies.  Delicious!  I would come back, if I actually lived in SF.
author: Nina A.

description: OMG can I just say YUM!!!!! The best coffee ice cream sandwich ever! I wish there is one closer to home! If you are in the marina please do yourself a favor and stop by this little ice cream shop!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Warm, melty chocolate chip cookies with a big scoop of mint chip ice cream......amazing!  People were really great too.  Nice addition to the hood.
author: Eamonn T.

description: Walked in the other day to check it out, looked like a shitty version of Cream in Berkeley. The cookies didn't look that good and the decor/ambiance was subpar.
author: Olivia F.

description: Over the moon is scrumptious! Their funfetti ice cream is as good as it gets! Haven't tried many of their cookies but they look great and smell delicious. Love this little local spot!
author: Ashley S.

description: This place is awesome. Super friendly workers and tasty ice cream sammys make for a great spot in the marina, especially when it's so nice outside like it was today. The cookies are fresh baked and delicious, we tried the oreo, chocolate chip and peanut butter. The caramel crunch coffee ice cream was really awesome, as was the Whiskey something or other.
author: Kajal G.

description: Been here a few times already! Lots of great ice cream flavors to choose from, I love the pistachio and vanilla. Also have delicious cookies and cute pies. Tried a warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream the other day. Absolutely delicious. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kristin N.

description: OMG...sooooo good.... forget your normal ice cream sandwich. This is THE BOMB. you will never buy a store bought ice cream sandwich again.
author: Julie K.

description: Frozen yogurt was SO yummy!! It was a sweet tart flavor and made my night! I will be back to this cute ice cream shop that smells like heaven!
author: V H.

description: Great homemade ice cream and generously & graciously served by Mele. She was so kind & cute, definitely added to an already great ice cream experience!
author: Linda S.

description: We stopped by here the first night we were in San Francisco....well...we were back the following 2 nights as well...The ice cream was on point and the service was exceptional..I will definitely be telling everyone back home about this gem.
author: Mr. C S.

description: We stopped here today while in the neighborhood for a trio of the ice cream sandwiches with some friends.  They make the ice cream AND the cookies in house, from scratch (unlike Cream, which can tastes a bit like grocery-store cookie because I don't think they do).  I am a complete sucker for interesting flavors so had a lot of fun putting together flavors (earl grey and lavender honey on snicker doodle really works well! So does cake batter and chocolate on chocolate chip cookie).  Cookies were soft and amazing.  Also, the staff were super friendly and so helpful.  They are also very patient with samples as I worked through what my masterpiece ice cream sandwiches would be composed of!  Cannot wait to go back.
author: Corinna M.

description:
ahhhhhh..... $4 for a custom ice cream sandwich????!!!!! yyyyyayaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaasssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss 

my love life - completed. i now live for their amazing hand crafted ice cream.
author: Zak C.

description: The homemade ice cream here is top notch. Could smell the fresh baked cookies when I walked in. Got a scoop of coffee caramel crunch and it was excellent. I don't even normally like coffee ice cream.
author: Nathan B.

description: these are the kind of shops I like in my neighborhood. The owner behind the counter, friendly people, good service, great ice cream, AND: reasonably priced. I always felt I was being robbed at Tutti L. down the street when I paid $12 for two ice creams. I now know I was, as these guys can deliver a better product with a better service at a much lower price.
author: Peter J.

description: Love this place! It's such a cute idea and a perfect dessert or snack spot. Not too bad in price and the homemade ice cream and cookies are so very good. Coconut is right on!
author: Christine C.

description: Very disappointed. This place used to have One of the best ice creams in the neighborhood and friendly, good service. Today I came here for a usual weekend visit. The store was empty and when we came in the attendant didn't acknowledged us it was like we're not there. I had to ask her to place an order and even then she kept doing what she was doing for a minute or two, which didn't seem important or urgent. My wife ordered the pistachio that she always orders but it tasted sweeter than normal, and it had a different texture than usual, not as creamy. So we informed the attendant, Jasmine, explained it to her and asked gently if she could exchange it for us. She told us that she could, but she'd have to charge. Her bad attitude went on and it simply destroyed our experience. We ended up not eating our ice cream and will never come back. It's sad to see a good establishment in the neighborhood go to waste.
author: Rogerio B.

description: Best ice cream in town, great flavor choices, friendly service, low prices, open late.
author: Howard B.

description: Yum Yum and Double Yum. The custom ice cream sandwich is a must. Peanut Butter cookies with Honey Lavender ice cream!!!
author: Michael S.

description: really nice staff, tastey flavors, let us try lots of samples, put up with my crazy grandparents--awesome!
author: Alexander T.

description: If you like thick, creamy, dense and rich ice cream then this place is for you!  It is too heavy for me and very dense, more dense than gelato! Very sweet too. I prefer the texture and taste of Tin Pot ice cream in Palo Alto.
author: McKenzie L.

description: chocolate mint was very tasty and yumm ! so in luv with this place:) highly recommended !!
author: Nastaran G.

description: An explosion of joy in my mouth. Coffee ice cream cuddled lovingly between two WARM chocolate chip cookies. Such a simple dessert restaurant idea, but they got it right! I will definitely be back!
author: Jennie T.

description: Just stopped by to try something new. Omg best whiskey ice cream ever !!! You must go and try it
author: Fina M.

description: This place rocks. I went there as I was at the Hyatt for a few nights, right next door. I kept telling my girlfriend about it and she started getting annoyed. I was so pleasantly surprised as I had gone to other more well known ice cream shops around town looking for the exact experience that was offered here. First off the ice cream is cheap, like $2.30 for a large scoop. The taste and texture is off the charts good. The coffee crunch is amazing. And considering my main squeeze when it comes to ice cream, their chocolate is just what I was looking for. Gets an A+ from this ice cream enthusiast.
author: Paul P.

description: This place was so good we went back 2 nights in a row. I had the honey lavender both nights, others had mint chocolate chip and chocolate. The owner was so helpful offering samples. Great customer service and fresh delicious ice cream!
author: Lindsey G.
